destined	<h3>destined</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>命中注定的, 预定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Medicine is his destined profession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医学是他注定要从事的职业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were destined never to see each other again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们命中注定再也不能相见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was destined that they would marry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们结婚是缘分。</font><br>以…为目的地的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a train destined for London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一列开往伦敦的火车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shipment is destined for America.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这批货物将运往美国。</font><br>\n
destiny	<h3>destiny</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>命运; 天命; 天数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody knows his own destiny.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人知道自己的命运。</font><br>\n
destructive	<h3>destructive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>破坏性的, 毁灭性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is the most destructive storm in 20 years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是20年来破坏性最大的一次风暴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the end, it will be destructive of our whole society.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它最终会毁灭我们整个社会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those anticancer drugs are effective, but also destructive to white blood cells.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些抗癌药是有效的, 但也破坏白细胞。</font><br>\n
detain	<h3>detain</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>留住, 耽搁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bad weather detained us for several hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恶劣的天气耽搁了我们几个小时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher often detains the lazy pupils at school to do their homework.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师常把懒惰的学生留在学校写作业。</font><br>拘留, 扣留<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have detained two men for questioning at the police station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将两个人扣留在警察局准备审讯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three men were detained as suspects.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有三人被当做嫌疑犯拘留。</font><br>\n

disagreement	<h3>disagreement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>分歧, 意见不合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope this disagreement does not divide us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望意见不同不至于使我们分道扬镳。</font><br>\n

disappointment	<h3>disappointment</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>失望, 沮丧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She experienced a sharp pang of disappointment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她经历了失望的巨大痛苦。</font><br>令人失望的人或事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These children are prepared for the disappointments as well as the joys of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些孩子不仅准备享受生活的乐趣, 而且也准备经受生活中的失意。</font><br>\n
disastrous	<h3>disastrous</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>灾难性的, 造成灾害的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Carelessness in driving often results in disastrous accidents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 驾驶不慎常带来不幸的意外。</font><br>极坏的, 很糟的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The road was disastrous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 路面真糟糕。</font><br>\n
disc	<h3>disc</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>圆盘<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hands a metal disc to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把一个金属圆盘给我。</font><br>唱片; 磁盘, 光盘<br>\n
discard	<h3>discard</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>丢弃, 抛弃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should discard old beliefs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该抛弃旧观念。</font><br>不再使用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will discard the old books.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将不再使用这些旧书。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>打出的牌<br>废弃的东西<br>\n
discharge	<h3>discharge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>卸船<br>偿还<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has discharged his debts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已把债务偿清。</font><br>执行; 履行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She discharged all the responsibilities of a minister conscientiously.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她自觉地履行部长的一切职责。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>放出; 流出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wound is still discharging pus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这伤口仍在流脓。</font><br>开枪; 发射<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pistol discharged accidentally.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 手枪走火了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The policeman discharged his gun at the fleeing robbers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察向逃跑的强盗开了枪。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>获准离开, 释放<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After his discharge from the school, he went to Hong Kong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他离开学校后去了香港。</font><br>排放出的物体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wound hasn't healed, there's still some discharge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伤口没好, 还有些浓液。</font><br>\n

discredit	<h3>discredit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使不相信, 使怀疑; 败坏…的名声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The idea that the sun goes round the earth has long been discredited.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳绕着地球转的观念早已不为人们所信了。</font><br>拒绝相信, 不相信, 怀疑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One should discredit a good deal of what is printed in newspapers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对报纸上登的不少东西都不应相信。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>丧失信誉, 丧失名誉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their behaviour has bought discredit on English football.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的行为败坏了英国足球运动的声誉。</font><br>败坏名声的人或事, 耻辱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That boy is a discredit to his family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个男孩是家门的耻辱。</font><br>\n
discreet	<h3>discreet</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>谨慎的, 慎重的, 考虑周到的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I should make a few discreet enquiries about the firm before you sign anything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我应先审慎打探一下这家公司的底细, 然后你再签字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is very discreet in giving his opinions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发表意见他十分慎重。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It wasn't discreet of you to ring me up at the office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你打电话到我办公室真是太鲁莽了。</font><br>\n
discretion	<h3>discretion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>慎重, 谨慎<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must show discretion in choosing your friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你择友时必须慎重。</font><br>随意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is within your discretion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以自行决定。</font><br>\n
discrimination	<h3>discrimination</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>歧视<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spoke out against racial discrimination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他声言反对种族歧视。</font><br>辨别; 辨别力, 识别力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These robots are capable of shape discrimination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些机器人能辨别形状。</font><br>\n
disguise	<h3>disguise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>假扮, 化装; 伪装<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She disguised herself as a man, but she couldn't disguise her voice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她假扮成男人, 但改不了声音。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The raiders disguised themselves as security guards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 袭击者都装扮成了保安人员。</font><br>掩盖, 掩饰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is impossible to disguise the fact that business is bad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生意不好这件事无法隐瞒。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>伪装<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The spy's disguise was soon penetrated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 间谍的伪装不久便被识破了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went among the drug dealers in disguise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他化装混到毒品贩子当中。</font><br>伪装品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This false beard is his disguise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这假胡子是他的伪装用品。</font><br>\n

disintegrate	<h3>disintegrate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)破裂[分裂, 粉碎]; (使)崩溃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The box was so old; it just disintegrated when I picked it up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那箱子太破旧了, 我刚一提就散了。</font><br>\n
dislike	<h3>dislike</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>不喜欢, 厌恶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That man was disliked inside the college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全校的人都不喜欢这个人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I dislike to go to the cinema alone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢一个人去看电影。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mother dislikes our being together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我母亲不喜欢看到我们在一起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His wife dislikes him to be a smoker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他妻子不喜欢他当烟民。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dislikes you to disturb her so often.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不喜欢你经常去打扰她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I dislike my wife going out often.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我讨厌我妻子经常外出。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>不喜爱, 厌恶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't know why, but I took a strong dislike to him as soon as I saw him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 也不知道为什么, 我一见到他就十分讨厌。</font><br>不喜欢的东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have our likes and dislikes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都有自己的好恶。</font><br>\n

dismay	<h3>dismay</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使惊愕, 使焦虑, 使气馁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thought that she might fail the history test dismayed her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 想到历史可能考不及格时, 她很沮丧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was dismayed to learn that she had failed again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 得知她又一次失败, 我感到惊愕。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>惊愕, 气馁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am filled with dismay at the news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对这个消息极为震惊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To their dismay, the door was locked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 使他们惊慌的是, 门已被锁上了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Someone stole my house!” she said in dismay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “有人偷了我们家!”她惊恐地说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was dismayed when I recongnized the voice of Mrs. Bates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当我听出是贝茨夫人的声音时, 我感到丧气。</font><br>\n
dismissal	<h3>dismissal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>解雇, 免职, 开除<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dismissal of five workmen caused a strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开除五个工人引起了罢工。</font><br>\n
disorder	<h3>disorder</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>混乱, 凌乱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When returning, he discovered the room in disorder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回家后, 他发现屋子里乱七八糟。</font><br>骚乱, 动乱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The announcement led to violent civil disorders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项宣布引起剧烈的骚乱。</font><br>(身心、机能)失调<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's suffering from severe mental disorder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他患有严重的精神病。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…弄乱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Too rich a diet will disorder his digestive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太油腻的饮食会使他的消化系统变得紊乱。</font><br>\n
dispatch	<h3>dispatch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>派遣, 调遣, 发送<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A messenger was dispatched to take the news to the soldiers at the front.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一名通讯员被派遣给前线士兵送消息。</font><br>匆匆吃[做]完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We soon dispatched the chocolate cake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们很快就吃完了巧克力蛋糕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chairman dispatched the meeting in 20 minutes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主席仅用20分钟就结束了会议。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>急件, 快信<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must ask someone to carry a dispatch from Rome to London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得派人把急件由罗马送往伦敦。</font><br>(记者发回的)新闻报道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp London newspapers receive dispatches from all parts of the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伦敦各报每天收到来自全世界各地的新闻报道。</font><br>派遣, 调遣<br>\n
disperse	<h3>disperse</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)散开, 驱散<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After school the children dispersed to their homes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 放学后, 孩子们四散回家了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police dispersed the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察驱散了群众。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clouds dispersed themselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 云散了。</font><br>\n
displace	<h3>displace</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>替换, 取代<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was displaced by another young man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已被另一个年轻人顶替。</font><br>移走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The war has displaced thousands of people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争使成千上万的人背井离乡。</font><br>\n
disposal	<h3>disposal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>清除, 处理, 处置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The safe disposal of nuclear waste is a major problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安全处置核废料是个大问题。</font><br>排列, 布置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You had better discuss with her the disposal of the furniture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你最好和她讨论一下如何布置家具。</font><br>\n
dispose	<h3>dispose</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>处理; 处置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He disposed his books on the shelves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把书籍排列在书架上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>布置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They disposed troops along the river.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们沿着河布署军队。</font><br>使愿意或准备做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His criminal records do not dispose me to trust him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的前科迫使我无法信任他。</font><br>\n
disrupt	<h3>disrupt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使混乱, 扰乱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An accident has disrupted railway services into and out of the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一场事故使得进出该城市的铁路交通陷入混乱。</font><br>\n
dissent	<h3>dissent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>意见的分歧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He expressed dissent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他表示了不同意见。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>不同意, 持异议<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We dissented from the decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对那项决定我们表示了不同意见。</font><br>\n
dissident	<h3>dissident</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>持异议者, 公开大唱反调者; 持不同政见者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That was the dissident movement in Poland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是波兰的持不同政见者的运动。</font><br>\n
dissolve	<h3>dissolve</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)溶解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun dissolves snow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳使雪融化。</font><br>结束<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The campaign dissolved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场运动结束了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They dissolved their marriage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们结束了他们的婚姻。</font><br>\n
distant	<h3>distant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(时间或空间)远隔的, 遥远的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That is a distant country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是一个遥远的国度。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It happened in the distant past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此事发生在遥远的过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The airport is ten miles distant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机场离此地有十英里远。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The village is rather distant from here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小村离这里还相当远。</font><br>远亲的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a distant cousin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是我的远房表妹。</font><br>不太友好, 不太热情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her manner was rather distant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的态度相当冷淡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He remained distant from the people he worked with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对同事们始终敬而远之。</font><br>\n
distinct	<h3>distinct</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>截然不同的, 完全分开的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The party split into two distinct groups.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该党分裂成两个截然不同的团体。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those two ideas are quite distinct.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两个主意完全不同。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Gold is distinct from iron.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 金在性质上不同于铁。</font><br>清晰的, 明白的, 明显的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a distinct improvement in your spoken English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的英语口语有明显的进步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His pronunciation is quite distinct.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的发音非常清楚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her voice is very distinct.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的嗓音很清晰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is distinct that smoking is harmful to health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很明显, 抽烟对健康有害。</font><br>\n
distinction	<h3>distinction</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>区别, 明显差别, 特征<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't see any distinction between these two cases.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看不出这两个案例有什么不同。</font><br>卓越, 优秀, 盛名<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a writer of real distinction.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一位真正才智超群的作家。</font><br>荣誉, 殊荣, 奖赏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These are the highest distinctions that have ever been given by our government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些是我国政府迄今授予的最高荣誉称号。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has gained a distinction in various fields of scholarly studies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在多种科学的学术研究中享有盛名。</font><br>\n

distress	<h3>distress</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>悲痛, 痛苦, 忧伤, 苦恼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing could alleviate his distress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 什么都不能减轻他的痛苦。</font><br>贫困, 窘迫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How can we prevent such distress?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们怎样才能避免这种贫困?</font><br>危险, 困难, 危难<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Send out a distress signal;  the ship is sinking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发出求救信号吧, 船正在下沉。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使痛苦, 使忧伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please don't distress yourself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请你不要忧愁了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news of his death distressed us greatly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他逝世的消息使我们极为悲痛。</font><br>\n

dose	<h3>dose</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(一次)剂量, 一剂, 一份<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave me a dose of medicine for my cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给我开了一剂治感冒的药。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bottle contains six doses of liquid medicine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个瓶子里有六次服量的药水。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the accident, the workers received a heavy dose of radiation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那次事故中, 工人受到大剂量的辐射。</font><br>一场, 一次, 一回<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What you need is a good dose of laughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你需要的是大笑一场。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>给…服药<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dosed up the children with cough syrup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把止咳糖浆给孩子们喝了。</font><br>\n
dot	<h3>dot</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>点, 小圆点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Join the dots up to complete the drawing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 顺点连线把图画好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a dot between 6 and 0.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在六和零之间有一个小数点。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>以小圆点标出<br>分布各处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sky was dotted with stars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天上繁星密布。</font><br>打, 击(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dotted me in the eye.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他击中了我的眼睛。</font><br>\n
doubtful	<h3>doubtful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>难以预测的, 未定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a doubtful battle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一场胜负难测的战争。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm doubtful where to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该往哪里去我心中无底。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I feel doubtful what I ought to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知该做什么。</font><br>怀疑的, 可疑的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's try to clear up our difficult and doubtful points.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们设法把难处和疑点解决一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I feel very doubtful about this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对这点很怀疑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am very doubtful of that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很疑心那件事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is doubtful whether it is true or not.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事的真假是可疑的。</font><br>\n
downstairs	<h3>downstairs</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在楼下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John's father is waiting downstairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰的父亲在楼下等着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cried out that she was downstairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她大声喊道她在楼下。</font><br>向[往]楼下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went downstairs to breakfast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他下楼去吃早饭了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>楼下的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lives in a downstairs room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他住在楼下的一个房间里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The downstairs rooms are not as quiet as the upstairs ones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 楼下房间没有楼上房间安静。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>楼下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We haven't painted the downstairs yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们还没有给楼下刷漆。</font><br>\n

equip	<h3>equip</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>装备, 配备<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They equipped themselves with a pair of sharp axes and set off for the forest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们带上两把利斧便朝森林走去。</font><br>使有能力, 使胜任<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His evening study has equipped him for a career as a teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夜校的学习使他能担任教师的工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your education will equip you to earn a good living.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你所受的教育会使你过上富裕的生活。</font><br>\n
erect	<h3>erect</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>竖立的, 直立的, 挺立的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is an erect pine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那儿有一棵挺拔的松树。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers stand erect.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵笔直地站着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She held her head erect and her back straight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她昂着头, 把背挺得笔直。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使直立; 竖起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They erected a telephone pole.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们竖起一根电话线杆子。</font><br>〈正〉建立<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't want to see a system like that will be erected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不希望看到那种制度被建立起来。</font><br>\n
erode	<h3>erode</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>侵蚀, 腐蚀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The coast is slowly eroding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海岸正慢慢地被侵蚀。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sea erodes the rock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海水侵蚀岩石。</font><br>\n
erotic	<h3>erotic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(引起)性欲的; 色情的<br>\n
erupt	<h3>erupt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>爆发, 喷发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Volcanoes and geysers erupt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火山和间歇喷泉均能喷发。</font><br>突然发生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Laughter erupted from the audience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 笑声从观众席上爆发出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The demonstrations erupted into violence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 示威游行爆发成暴力行为。</font><br>出疹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rashes have erupted all over my back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我背上出满了疹子。</font><br>\n
escalate	<h3>escalate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)逐步升级; (使)逐步扩大<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government escalated the war by starting to bomb enemy cities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府开始轰炸敌方的城市, 使战争进一步扩大。</font><br>(使)更高, (使)更大<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cost of living is escalating.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生活费用在迅速上涨。</font><br>\n
escort	<h3>escort</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>护送者, 护卫队; 护航舰, 护航飞机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prisoner was taken under escort to the jail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罪犯被押送到监狱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her escort to the party was a tall young man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 陪同她参加晚会的是一位高个子男青年。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The king's escort total 50 men.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国王的警卫队总数达50人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>护送; 护卫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who will escort this young lady home?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁护送这位小姐回家?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Queen's yacht was escorted by destroyers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 女王的游艇由驱逐舰护航。</font><br>\n
essay	<h3>essay</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>散文, 随笔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's an essay heavy with surplus phrasing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是篇废话连篇的散文。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a thoughtful essay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一篇具有思想性的随笔。</font><br>\n
essence	<h3>essence</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>本质, 实质, 要素<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the above chapter, we have learned what the essence of translation is.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在上一章中, 我们学习了翻译的本质。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two things are the same in outward form but different in essence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两件东西外表形式一样, 但实质不同。</font><br>(植物, 药物等)精髓, 精华<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This factory produces essences.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家工厂生产香精。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her favourite essence smells like gardenias.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她喜欢的香水闻起来像栀子花。</font><br>\n

estate agent	<h3>estate agent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>房地产经纪人,代管房地产者<br>\n
esteem	<h3>esteem</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>尊敬, 敬重<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No one esteems your father more than I do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人比我更敬重你的父亲了。</font><br>认为, 以为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He esteemed that he understood what I had said.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他认为已经听懂我说的意思了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I did not esteem him to be worthy of trust.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为他不值得信赖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We esteem Sigmund Freud as the father of psychoanalysis.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们认为西格蒙德 · 弗罗伊德是精神分析学之父。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I esteem it an honour to attend this meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我能参加这次大会, 感到十分荣幸。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>尊敬; 好评<br>\n
eternal	<h3>eternal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>永恒的, 永久的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rome has been called the Eternal City.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罗马一向被称为不朽之城。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A wedding ring is a symbol of eternal love between a married couple.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 结婚戒指象征已婚夫妇之间永恒的爱。</font><br>似乎不停的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop this eternal chatter!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要唠叨个不停！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am tired of your eternal arguments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我讨厌你们没完没了的争吵。</font><br>\n
ethic	<h3>ethic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>道德规范,伦理<br>\n
ethical	<h3>ethical</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>伦理的; 道德的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is necessary to get the youth to have a high ethical concept.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 必须使青年具有高度的道德观念。</font><br>合乎道德的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I thought it was not ethical.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为那是不合乎道德的。</font><br>\n
evacuate	<h3>evacuate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>撤离, 疏散<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They all evacuated when the enemy approached the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌人逼近这个城市时他们已撤退了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tell them you intend to evacuate the children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 告诉他们你打算疏散儿童。</font><br>\n
evaluate	<h3>evaluate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>评价, 估计, 估价<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't evaluate his ability without seeing his work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有看到他的工作情况, 无法评论他的能力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The school has only been open for six months, so it's hard to evaluate its success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该学校仅开办了六个月, 现在还很难估计它的成就。</font><br>\n
eve	<h3>eve</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(宗教节日或假日的)前日, 前夕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'll have a party on New Year's Eve.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将在除夕举行晚会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On Christmas Eves we go to Grandma's home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每当圣诞前夕我们都到祖母家去。</font><br>(重大事件发生的)前一刻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He felt sick on the eve of the race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在比赛前病了。</font><br>\n

everyday	<h3>everyday</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>每天的, 日常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is everyday routine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是每天的例行公事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is a fact of everyday experience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是平日常见的事情。</font><br>\n
evident	<h3>evident</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>明显的, 明白的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He signed his name with evident satisfaction.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他显然很满意地签了名。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prospect became more evident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 前景变得更加明朗了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This fact is too evident to require proof.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这事实很明显, 用不着证明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is evident that smoking is harmful to health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很明显, 抽烟对健康有害。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's evident to me that they have no experience in this work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我看来, 他们干这项工作没有经验是显而易见的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The spokesman made it evident that no compromise was yet in sight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发言人表示, 目前还不会妥协。</font><br>\n
evidently	<h3>evidently</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>明显地, 显然<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Evidently, he has fallen in love with Miss Green.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 显然, 他爱上了格林小姐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was evidently too tired to go any further.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他显然太疲劳, 一步也走不动了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was born evidently in London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 显然, 他出生在伦敦。</font><br>\n
evoke	<h3>evoke</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>产生, 引起, 唤起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her speech evoked great anger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的讲话引起了极大的愤慨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The music evoked memories of her youth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这乐曲勾起了她对青年时期的回忆。</font><br>\n
evolution	<h3>evolution</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>演变; 进化; 发展<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the course of evolution, some birds have lost the power of flight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在进化的过程中, 一些鸟丧失了飞行能力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cultural and social evolution now becomes rapid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在文化和社会发展很快。</font><br>\n
evolve	<h3>evolve</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>演变; 进化<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Language is constantly and gradually evolving.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 语言在不断地缓慢发展。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has evolved a new theory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已形成了一种新学说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He evolved a system for making money quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想出了一套快速赚钱的方法。</font><br>\n
exaggerate	<h3>exaggerate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)扩大, (使)增加<br>夸大, 夸张<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always exaggerates when she tells something she's done.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每当她谈及自己所做的事时, 她总是言过其实。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He exaggerated the dangers of the trip in order to frighten them not into going.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他夸大了旅行的危险, 目的是恫吓他们, 以使他们不敢去。</font><br>\n
exaggerated	<h3>exaggerated</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>夸大的,言过其实的,夸张的<br>\n

exceed	<h3>exceed</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>超过; 超越<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The demand for fish this month exceeds the supply.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本月的鱼市供不应求。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The driver exceeds the speed limit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位司机超速驾车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their total grain output still exceeded that of the previous year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的粮食总产量仍超过头一年。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>(在数量、质量上)突出, 领先<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the Olympic Games Americans exceeded in basketball.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在奥运会上, 美国在篮球方面领先。</font><br>\n

exceptional	<h3>exceptional</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>优越的, 杰出的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a man of exceptional talent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是位具有非凡才能的人。</font><br>例外的; 独特的, 异常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our circumstances have been rather exceptional.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的情况相当特别。</font><br>\n
excessive	<h3>excessive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>过度的, 过分的; 极度的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She takes an excessive interest in clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她过分注重衣着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prices at this hotel are excessive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家旅馆的价钱贵得过分。</font><br>\n
excite	<h3>excite</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使兴奋, 使激动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This announcement greatly excited us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个通知使我们大为激动。</font><br>激发, 引起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The professor's lecture excited our interest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个教授讲的课引起了我们的兴趣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This excites crying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这引起了哭泣声。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The king's cruelty excited the people to rise against him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个国王的残酷激起了人民起来反对他。</font><br>\n
excited	<h3>excited</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>兴奋的, 激动的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was getting excited just thinking about the trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一想到那次旅行他就兴奋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was quite excited to hear that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听到那事我非常激动。</font><br>喜悦的, 快乐的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were excited with joy at the success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们为成功而欣喜若狂。</font><br>\n
excitement	<h3>excitement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>兴奋, 激动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Very great excitement prevails throughout the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全国到处洋溢着极度兴奋的情绪。</font><br>令人兴奋的事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Life will seem very quiet after the excitements of our holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 假期一阵兴奋后, 生活会显得很平静。</font><br>\n
exclude	<h3>exclude</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>排除; 不包括在内<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Closing the windows excludes street noises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关窗使街上吵闹的声音不能进来。</font><br>\n
exclusion	<h3>exclusion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>拒绝, 排除<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>排外主义者<br>\n
exclusive	<h3>exclusive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>高级的, 奢华的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He often goes to the exclusive restaurants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他经常去高级饭馆。</font><br>专用的; 独家的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This bathroom is for the President's exclusive use.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这间浴室是总统专用的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The story is exclusive to this newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家报纸独家报道这个材料。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>独家新闻, 独家报道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you pay me ￡ 20, 000, I'll give your paper the story as an exclusive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果付给我2万英镑, 我就给你的报纸独家报道这件事。</font><br>\n

这顶帽子挺合适的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His great height fitted him to play basketball.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的身材高大, 适合打篮球。</font><br>试穿<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>合适的, 适宜的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only fit applicants need application.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有符合条件的申请人需要申请。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is fit for the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她适合做这项工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water is not fit to drink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这水不适宜饮用。</font><br>健康的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You look very fit.</font></i><br><font flare	<h3>flare</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)闪耀；(使)闪亮；(使)照耀；(使)燃烧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The torch flares in the darkness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火炬在黑暗中闪光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The blood-red light of down flared on her face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火红的朝霞映照在她的脸上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire flared into life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火旺了起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The breeze flared the candle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 微风吹得烛光摇曳不定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her flared her scarf to catch my eye.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她炫示她的围巾以引我注目。</font><br>(使)(衣裙、酒杯等)呈喇叭形展开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her new skirt flares at the knees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的新裙子在膝部向外展开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The skirt should be flared at the bottom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 裙子下端应展开。</font><br>(使)鼻孔张大<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her nostrils flared with anger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她气得两个鼻孔都鼓了起来。</font><br>(使)(船舷)外倾<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The side of a ship flares from the keel to the deck.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船舷从龙骨向甲板外倾。</font><br>(使)(飞机着陆前)滑行平飞<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br><br>突发；突然发怒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flighting flared after a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战斗在一周后突然爆发。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He flared at me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对我突然发起火来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>摇曳的火焰；闪光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The breeze flared the candle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 微风吹得烛光不定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The match gave a last flare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火柴发出最后的亮光。</font><br>闪光信号；照明弹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stood ready to fire a warning flare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他站着准备发出警告信号。</font><br>炫耀；招摇<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her flared her scarf to catch my eye.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她炫示她的围巾以引我注目。</font><br>(声音、怒气等的)爆发<br>(衣裙、酒杯等的)呈喇叭形展开<br>(船舷的)外倾<br>(太阳的)耀斑<br>(皮肤的)红肿块<br>\n
flesh	<h3>flesh</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>肉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A fat man has much more flesh than a thin man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 胖人较瘦人肉多。</font><br>果肉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flesh of the peach was sweet and juicy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桃子的果肉甜而多汁。</font><br>肉体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His life was devoted to the pleasure of the flesh.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一生贪图肉体上的舒适享受。</font><br>\n

forthcoming	<h3>forthcoming</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>即将到来的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave me a list of their forthcoming books.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给了我一张他们即将出版图书的目录。</font><br>现成的, 唾手可得的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The funds are not forthcoming.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 资金尚未就绪。</font><br>\n
fortnight	<h3>fortnight</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>两星期, 十四天<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need a break. Why not take a fortnight off from work?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你需要休息, 为什么不休假两周呢?</font><br>\n
fortunate	<h3>fortunate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>交好运的, 带来好运的; 幸运的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lack of good diagnostic test isn't fortunate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 缺乏好的诊断性测试是不利的。</font><br>\n
fortunately	<h3>fortunately</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>幸运地; 幸亏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was late in getting to the station, but fortunately for me, the train was late too.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我到达火车站时已经迟了, 但是幸亏火车也误了点。</font><br>\n
forum	<h3>forum</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>集会的公共场所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Yesterday we visited the forum of ancient Romans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天我们参观了古罗马的公共集会广场。</font><br>论坛, 讨论会, 专题讨论节目<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They're holding a forum on new ways of teaching history.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在举行历史教学讨论会。</font><br>\n
fossil	<h3>fossil</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>化石<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fossils may be a million years old.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些化石可能有100万年了。</font><br>老顽固, 食古不化的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man is a fossil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那人是个老顽固。</font><br>\n

foul	<h3>foul</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>难闻的, 发臭的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house was filled with foul odour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间里充满了难闻的气味。</font><br>令人不愉快的, 糟透了的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've had a foul morning; everything's gone wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今天早上很不愉快, 事事不对劲。</font><br>污浊的, 肮脏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take off those foul clothes and let me wash them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 脱下那些脏衣服让我洗一洗。</font><br>下流的, 辱骂性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many were shocked by his foul language.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多人对他那下流的语言感到震惊。</font><br>恶劣的; 有暴风雨的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What a foul day it is!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多么恶劣的天气!</font><br>邪恶的, 罪恶的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Murder is a foul deed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谋杀是件非常丑恶的事。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使污秽; 弄脏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smoke fouled the air.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烟污染了空气。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>纠缠; 纠结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rope fouled the anchor chain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 绳子与锚链缠在一起。</font><br>〈体〉(对…)犯规<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The footballer tried to foul.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个足球运动员试图犯规。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was sent off for fouling the other team's goalkeeper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因对对方守门员犯规而被罚出场。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>犯规<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The player was sent off the field because of fouls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这名运动员因屡屡犯规而被罚下场。</font><br>\n

furious	<h3>furious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>狂怒的, 暴怒的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a furious temper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他脾气狂暴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His wife was furious with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他妻子对他大发雷霆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was furious that we left without him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们扔下他就走了, 他非常生气。</font><br>强烈的, 激烈的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a furious storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是强烈的暴风雨。</font><br>\n
furthermore	<h3>furthermore</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>而且, 此外<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't want to go there, furthermore, I have no time to do so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想去那里, 而且我也没时间去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't like her because she is too tall and furthermore she smokes too much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢她, 因为她太高, 另外她抽烟太厉害。</font><br>\n
fury	<h3>fury</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>狂怒, 暴怒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He flew into a fury and said that the whole thing was disgusting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他勃然大怒, 说这一切令人作呕。</font><br>激烈, 猛烈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a fury of activity on the morning of their departure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们离开的那个早上, 群情激昂。</font><br>\n
fuss	<h3>fuss</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>小题大做; 大惊小怪<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop fussing!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要大惊小怪！</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>烦恼, 激动(尤指对小事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish you would stop fussing me about; I'm quite able to look after myself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 但愿你不要为我过于操心了, 我挺能照顾我自己的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>忙乱, 大惊小怪, 小题大做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop all this fuss and do your homework.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别大惊小怪了, 去做你的家庭作业吧。</font><br>抱怨<br>焦急, 紧张<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old lady soon got into a fuss.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老妇人很快就紧张起来。</font><br>\n
gallon	<h3>gallon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>加仑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd like five gallons of wine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要五加仑葡萄酒。</font><br>\n
gamble	<h3>gamble</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>赌博; 冒风险<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gambles when he is in cash.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有钱时就赌博。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he had gambled his money, he was put to shifts to live.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他输光了钱就凑合着过日子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gambled his savings to start a small store.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他孤注一掷地用自己的积蓄开了一家小店。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The federal government gambled hundreds of thousands of dollars in research funds to work on the project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 联邦政府为了这项研究计划冒险动用了好几十万美元的资金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their house and land were all gambled and lost by her husband that morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的房子、土地就在那一天上午被她丈夫全输光了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I gambled that they wouldn't shoot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我大胆假定他们不会开枪。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>赌博, 打赌; 投机, 冒险<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Setting up this business was a bit of a gamble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开办这样的公司有点冒险。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The operation may succeed, and it may not;  it's a bit of a gamble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次手术没把握, 可能成功, 也可能失败。</font><br>\n
gambling	<h3>gambling</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>赌博, 赌钱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government is framing a new bill to put a cap on gambling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府正在制定新的法案以对赌博加以限制。</font><br>冒险; 投机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a taste for gambling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他爱好冒险。</font><br>\n
garage	<h3>garage</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>车库<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Outside this door is the garage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车房在门外边。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The estate consists of a main house, servants' quarters, a garage, stables and 100 acres of woods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这地产包括一栋住宅, 仆人住室, 一个汽车房, 几间马厩及100英亩的树林。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car knocked against the garage door and damaged it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车撞在车房门上, 把门撞坏了。</font><br>汽车修理站; 加油站<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We called at a garage, where we were soon fitted up with what we needed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们到了加油站, 在那里我们需要的东西很快得到了供应。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a garage mechanic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一名加油站技工。</font><br>\n

gasp	<h3>gasp</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>喘气, 喘息, 倒抽气<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The exhausted runner threw himself down and gasped.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位筋疲力尽的赛跑运动员一头栽倒, 直喘气。</font><br>很想要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Did you need a drink?”“Yes, I'm gasping!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ”“你要喝点什么吗?”“我巴不得能喝点!”</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>喘着气说出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The excited boy gasped the news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个激动的男孩喘着气说出了这个消息。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>喘气, 喘息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave a gasp of surprise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她吃惊得大口喘气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My breaths were coming in gasps.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我急促地喘起气来。</font><br>\n

gauge	<h3>gauge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>厚度, 直径<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What gauge of wire should we use for this job?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们干这活应该用多大号的铁丝?</font><br>测量仪表<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fuel gauges dropped swiftly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 燃料表指针迅速下降。</font><br>规格, 尺度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What gauge of wire do you require?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你需要什么规格的电线?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>计量, 度量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A thermometer gauges the temperature.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 温度计可测量温度。</font><br>估计, 判断<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's difficult to gauge one's character.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要判断一个人的品格是很困难的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you gauge what her reaction is likely to be?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能揣测她的反应可能是什么吗?</font><br>\n

gland	<h3>gland</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈解〉腺<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her mother has an underactive adrenal gland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的母亲肾上腺机能不全。</font><br>\n
glare	<h3>glare</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>怒目而视<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>发强光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These colours glare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些颜色太显眼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun glared on the sea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳在海上发出令人目眩的光芒。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>强光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The glare of the headlights almost blinded us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车前灯耀眼的光使我们睁不开眼。</font><br>怒视, 瞪眼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked at him with an angry glare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她生气地瞪着他。</font><br>炫耀, 张扬<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were in the full glare of publicity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们大肆炫耀。</font><br>\n
gleam	<h3>gleam</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)闪烁, (使)闪亮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The furniture gleamed after being polished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 擦过的家具发亮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun gleamed on naked swords.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阳光把出鞘的剑照得闪闪发亮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane glided peacefully and its wings gleamed white.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这飞机平稳地滑行, 机翼泛着白光。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>闪光, 闪亮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They saw the gleam of a lamp ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们看到前面的灯光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A few faint gleams of sunshine lit up the gloomy afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几束隐约的阳光使阴暗的下午有些明亮。</font><br>闪现, 流露<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lamplight struck a gleam from her bracelets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的手镯在灯光的照射下闪闪发亮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A gleam of interest came into his eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的眼里流露出一丝关切的目光。</font><br>\n
glimpse	<h3>glimpse</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>瞥见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I glimpsed her among the crowd just now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我刚才看到她在人群里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I glimpsed a bleak future.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我隐约感到前途黯淡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She glimpsed him leaving.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她瞥见他走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I glimpsed a rat running past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看到一只老鼠跑过去了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一瞥, 一看<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One glimpse at himself in the mirror was enough.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让他照着镜子看自己一眼就够了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She catches a glimpse of a car in the distance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一眼就瞥见了远处的汽车。</font><br>\n
glitter	<h3>glitter</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>闪烁, 闪耀, 闪光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stars glittered in a clear sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 星星在晴空闪烁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The diamond ring glittered on his finger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 钻戒在他的手指上闪闪发亮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She glittered at the elegant table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她坐在典雅的桌子旁边显得光彩照人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>灿烂的光辉; 闪烁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child was attracted by the glitter of the Christmas tree decorations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子被圣诞树上闪闪发光的装饰品吸引住了。</font><br>(表面的)诱惑力, 吸引力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Beneath its surface glitter, the fashion industry is a tough place to work in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时装业表面上光彩迷人, 但其实是个辛苦的行业。</font><br>\n
globe	<h3>globe</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>地球, 世界<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is plenty of water on the face of the globe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地球表面有大量的水。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We're planning to travel round the globe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正计划做一次环球旅行。</font><br>球体; 球状物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun is an immense globe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳是一个巨大的球体。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The silvery globe of the moon hung in the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 银盘似的月亮悬挂在空中。</font><br>地球仪<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We use a globe in our geography class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在地理课上使用地球仪。</font><br>\n
gloom	<h3>gloom</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>昏暗, 阴暗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the gathering gloom it was difficult to see anything distinctly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在越来越暗的情况下, 什么东西都看不清。</font><br>忧郁, 沮丧, 失望<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news of defeat filled them all with gloom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 失败的消息使他们满怀郁闷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news cast a deep gloom over the whole family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个消息使全家笼罩着一片愁云惨雾。</font><br>\n
gloomy	<h3>gloomy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>黑暗的, 阴暗的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The little boy sat in a gloomy corner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小男孩坐在一个阴暗的角落。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is so gloomy in the room that you should turn on the light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间内太暗, 你应该打开灯。</font><br>令人沮丧的, 令人失望的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I saw their gloomy faces, I knew something was wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当我看到他们沮丧的脸时, 我知道出事了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Chances of getting the job were slim, so the young man felt gloomy about the future.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 得到这份工作的机会很小, 所以这位青年人感到前途渺茫。</font><br>\n

glory	<h3>glory</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>光荣, 荣誉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was bathed in glory on the day he became the Ministry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在成为部长的那一天他感到无上光荣。</font><br>美丽, 壮丽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After years of neglect-ing, the palace has been restored to its former glory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过若干年的沉寂, 这座宫殿恢复了以往的壮丽。</font><br>非常美的事物; 给人荣耀的事, 值得称赞的事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Being knighted by the Queen was the crowning glory of his long and successful career.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由女王授予爵士荣衔是他漫长而成功的经历中的无上荣誉。</font><br>\n

glow	<h3>glow</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>(无焰地)燃烧; 发炽热; 烧红<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cigarette glowed in the dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 黑暗中有支香烟发着光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole countryside glowed with autumn tints.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乡间处处呈现出灿烂的秋色。</font><br>脸红, 身体发热<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His cheeks glowed after the race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 赛跑后他满脸通红。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>光亮, 光辉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a dull red glow in the night sky above the steelworks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夜晚炼钢厂的上空闪着暗红色的光。</font><br>脸红, (身体)发热<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I felt a pleasant glow in all my veins from the wine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喝过酒后我浑身的血都热烘烘的, 感到很舒服。</font><br>热情; 强烈的感情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt a glow of satisfaction at her son's achievements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因儿子的成就而感到心满意足。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The glow went out of his voice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说话的声音不那么激动了。</font><br>\n

grace	<h3>grace</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>优美<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gymnast performed on the balance beam with an easy grace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 体操运动员在平衡木上表演得优美自如。</font><br>风度, 魅力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A young man with graces appeared on the stage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 舞台上出现了一位风度翩翩的年轻人。</font><br>宽限, 缓期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Payment is due today, but I gave her a week's grace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天付款到期, 但我给了她一个星期的宽限。</font><br>恩泽, 善意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had been the king's favourite, and his sudden fall from grace surprised everyone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他本是国王的宠臣, 一朝失宠众人都感到意外。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>修饰或装扮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fine paintings graced the walls of the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些精美的绘画使四壁生辉。</font><br>\n

grateful	<h3>grateful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>感激的, 感谢的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sent us a grateful letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们给我们寄来了一封感谢信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd be very grateful if you could let me know as soon as possible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你尽快让我知道我将非常感激。</font><br>\n
gravity	<h3>gravity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>万有引力; 地心引力; 重力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An apple falls down because of gravity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于重力的关系, 苹果往下掉。</font><br>严重性; 严肃, 庄严<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He doesn't think you realize the gravity of the situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他认为你没意识到局势的严重性。</font><br>\n
graze	<h3>graze</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(让动物)吃草<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cattle are grazing in the field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 牛群在田野上吃草。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We're grazing the sheep in the next field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在旁边一块地里放羊。</font><br>轻擦; 擦破<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has grazed his knee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他擦伤了膝盖。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>擦过, 掠过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane grazed the hilltops.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机擦着山顶飞过。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>擦伤<br>\n

grill	<h3>grill</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>烧烤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's grilling out there in the midday sun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在外面让中午火辣辣的太阳炙烤着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll grill you some mutton.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来给你烤一些羊肉吃。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>拷问, 盘问<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was grilled for two hours before the police let him go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被严厉盘查了两个小时后, 警察才放他走。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>烤架<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put it under the grill for a minute to brown the top.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 放在烤架下烤一分钟把上面烤成金黄色。</font><br>烧烤餐馆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They went to Murphy's Bar and Grill on 45th Street in New York.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们去了纽约第45号街的墨菲酒吧兼烧烤店。</font><br>(一盘)烤肉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She carried a piping hot grill of oysters and bacon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她端出一盘滚烫的烤牡蛎和咸肉。</font><br>格板, 格栅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bank clerk peered at the customer through the grill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 银行的职员从格栅后面看着顾客。</font><br>\n

grin	<h3>grin</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>咧嘴笑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know she is joking because she has a big grin on her face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道她是在开玩笑, 因为她满脸笑容。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>露齿而笑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She grinned with delight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她高兴地咧开嘴笑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was grinning proudly, delighted with his achievements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为自己的成就感到喜悦, 自豪地咧着嘴笑。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>露齿笑着表示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She grinned her delight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她露齿一笑表示高兴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He grinned his approval.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以一笑表示同意。</font><br>\n
grind	<h3>grind</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>磨碎; 嚼碎<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This wheat grinds well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种麦子很好磨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ground the knife sharp.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把刀磨锋利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you please grind a pound of coffee for me?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请给我磨一磅咖啡好吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>旋转开动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw the cigarette down and ground it under his heel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把烟卷丢到地上, 用脚踩灭。</font><br>压迫; 折磨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Slaves were mercilessly ground down by slave holders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 奴隶受奴隶主的残酷压迫。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>磨, 碾<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are several different grinds of coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有好几种不同等级的磨好的咖啡。</font><br>苦差事, 苦活儿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you find learning English a grind?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你觉得学英语是件苦事吗?</font><br>\n

hack	<h3>hack</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>劈, 砍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hacked at the branch until it fell off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他朝着树枝砍, 直到砍下来为止。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>狠踢, 乱踢<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>咳嗽(发出刺耳声音)<br>(以普通速度)骑马<br>驾驶计程车<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>砍, 劈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a hack at the log.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他朝圆木上砍了一下。</font><br>用靴头踢<br>骑用马, 供出租的马<br>受雇于出版商的文人<br>出租车, 出租车司机<br>\n
hail	<h3>hail</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>雹子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hail fell with such violence that it broke windows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冰雹猛落, 把玻璃窗也砸破了。</font><br>一阵<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a hail of angry words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 愤怒的话语如冰雹似地砸来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>下雹子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's hailing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正在下冰雹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sometimes it hails during a summer thundershower.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有时候夏天的雷阵雨中会夹有冰雹。</font><br>如冰雹般地降下<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>致敬; 向…欢呼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Millions of people hailed the astronauts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 数百万人向宇航员们欢呼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hailed us cordially.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们热情地欢迎我们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Here comes the new teacher, let's hail him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新老师来了, 我们欢迎他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hailed them as soon as they stood on the stage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一站到台上, 我们就开始欢迎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The people lined the streets to hail the returning heroes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们夹道欢迎凯旋的英雄们。</font><br>打信号示意(计程车等)停下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hailed a taxi for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她给他叫了一辆出租车。</font><br>\n

hammer	<h3>hammer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>锤, 铁榔头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The only tools in the house are a hammer and a saw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 屋子里仅有的工具是一把锤子和一把锯。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>锤打<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hammered a picture frame.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我钉了个相框。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In order to hang the picture, he had to hammer a nail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为了挂那幅画, 他必须钉枚钉子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The blacksmith is hammering the red-hot metal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 铁匠正在锤烧红的铁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hammer metal with a hammer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用铁锤锤打金属。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hammered it flat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用锤子把它敲平。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The worker hammered the iron flat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人把铁锤平了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The machine can hammer metal very thin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台机器能把金属锤得很薄。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>击败<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hammered a team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们击败了一支队伍。</font><br>\n
