harvest	<h3>harvest</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>收割, 收获;  收获季节, 收获期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the harvest, the peasants began to prepare the soil for seed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 收割后, 农民就开始整地以便播种。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The summer harvest is about to start.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夏收即将开始。</font><br>收成, 收获量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a good harvest that year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那一年收成好。</font><br>结果<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is not easy to reap the harvest of my hard work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 获得自己辛勤工作的成果是不容易的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>收割, 收成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try to harvest the fruit before the first frost.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在第一次霜冻以前要设法把水果收摘完。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>收到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He harvested rewards in fame and wealth for his successful experiment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因试验成功而名利双收。</font><br>\n

haul	<h3>haul</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>拖, 拉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you haul hard you will divert the fish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果拉网太猛, 鱼会被吓跑的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fishermen haul the net.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 渔民们拉鱼网。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>运送<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Trains haul freight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火车拖运货物。</font><br>传讯<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>拖, 拉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rope stood up under the strain of the haul.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这绳子经受不住紧拉。</font><br>拖运货物的距离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a long haul home and we arrived exhausted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 搬运回家的这段路程特别长, 到家时我们已筋疲力尽。</font><br>一网的捕获量, 一次偷得的数量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fisherman had a good haul.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 渔夫捕到一大网鱼。</font><br>\n
haunt	<h3>haunt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>经常出没于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He haunted textile mills, and learned all he could.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他常到纺织厂去, 尽可能多学点东西。</font><br>缠绕, 萦绕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Memories of her childhood haunted her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 童年时代的记忆经常在她脑中萦绕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a problem that haunts all of us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个使我们大家都担忧不已的问题。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>某人常去的地方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The area was a haunt of criminals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地区是罪犯经常出没的地方。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is one of my favourite haunts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是我最喜欢常去的地方之一。</font><br>\n
haven	<h3>haven</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>港口; 安全地方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The library is a haven of peace and quiet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 图书馆是个平和而安静的去处。</font><br>\n
hawk	<h3>hawk</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>鹰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A hawk hovered in the blue sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一只老鹰在蓝色的天空中翱翔。</font><br>鹰派人物, 主战派人物<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>沿街叫卖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is hawking his goods everywhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在到处兜售他的货物。</font><br>\n
hazard	<h3>hazard</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>尝试着做[提出]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have not used this article before, but they are willing to hazard a try.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种商品他们以前从未用过, 但愿意尝试一次。</font><br>冒风险<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't hazard your reputation by supporting that crook.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要冒败坏你名声的危险去支持那个坏蛋。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>危险; 公害<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He climbed into the car at the hazard of his life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他冒着生命危险进了汽车。</font><br>\n

honestly	<h3>honestly</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>诚实地, 正直地<br>坦诚地, 实在地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will say I honestly think, even at the risk of offending people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 即使有可能冒犯人, 我也要说我真心所想的。</font><br>\n
honesty	<h3>honesty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>诚实, 正直, 坦诚<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Honesty is the best policy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 诚实才是上策。</font><br>\n
honey	<h3>honey</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>蜂蜜<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Honey is very sweet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蜂蜜很甜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your tea is sweetened with honey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的茶里加了蜂蜜变甜了。</font><br>〈口〉亲爱的; 宝贝<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I love you, honey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我爱你, 亲爱的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come here, my honeys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到这儿来, 我的宝贝们。</font><br>可爱的东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That new car of his is a real honey!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的那辆新汽车真是棒极了！</font><br>\n
hop	<h3>hop</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>单足蹦跳, 跳跃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children had a competition to see who could hop the fastest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们举行比赛, 看谁单足跳跃最快。</font><br>跳上[下]<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>跃过, 跳过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ditch was so broad that no animal can hop it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有动物能跃过这么宽的一条沟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hopped the hedge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跳过篱笆。</font><br>搭乘<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp During the depression, I used to hop freights at least once a month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大萧条时期, 我一月至少偷偷搭乘一次货运列车。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>蹦跳, 跳跃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sparrow crossed the lawn in a series of hops.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那麻雀一蹦一跳地穿过草坪。</font><br>跳舞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you coming to the hop tonight?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚你来跳舞吗?</font><br>一次飞行的距离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a short hop from London to Paris.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从伦敦到巴黎是短程飞行。</font><br>\n
hopeful	<h3>hopeful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>抱有希望的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm not very hopeful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不抱太多希望。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are hopeful about the future.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对未来抱乐观态度。</font><br>给人以希望的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a hopeful news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个鼓舞人心的消息。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>有成功希望的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audition was attended by a score of young hopefuls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 参加试音的是20个有成功希望的年轻人。</font><br>\n

hurl	<h3>hurl</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>猛投, 用力掷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The young track and field athlete could already hurl the discus 60 yards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个年轻的田径运动员已能把铁饼掷60码远。</font><br>大声叫骂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hurled curses at the unfortunate man who had made the mistake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对着这个犯了错误的可怜人大声叫骂。</font><br>\n
hurricane	<h3>hurricane</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>飓风, (尤指西印度群岛的)旋风<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hurricane blew with such force that trees were uprooted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飓风强烈地刮着, 树都被连根拔起了。</font><br>\n
hurry	<h3>hurry</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>催促; 急忙<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's hurry a bit, we are far behind them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们得快点, 咱们比他们落后多了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we hurry the work, it may be spoiled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是我们匆忙地把工作干完, 可能会把事情弄糟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The salesman hurried the customer to make a choice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 售货员催促顾客赶快做出选择。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>匆忙, 急忙<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't drive so fast; there's no hurry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要开这么快, 不必急急忙忙的。</font><br>\n
hut	<h3>hut</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>小屋, 棚屋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The poor old man lived in a little wooden hut.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个贫穷的老人住在一间小木屋内。</font><br>\n
hybrid	<h3>hybrid</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>杂交生成的生物体, 杂交植物(或动物); 杂种, 混血儿<br>\n
hydrogen	<h3>hydrogen</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈化〉氢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hydrogen combines chemically with oxygen to form water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 氢和氧化合成为水。</font><br>\n
hype	<h3>hype</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>天花乱坠的广告宣传<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People went to see the movie because of all the hype.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们因各种天花乱坠的广告宣传而去看那部电影。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>大肆宣传<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Promoters really hyped the movie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 推销商大肆宣传那部电影。</font><br>\n

idle	<h3>idle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>空闲的, 闲着的<br>懒散的, 无所事事的<br>无根据的; 无聊的<br>无意义的, 无特别意图的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't know why I asked—just idle curiosity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道我为什么问这问题——只是出于无意义的好奇心吧。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>虚度, 闲逛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They idled before cafes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在餐馆前闲逛。</font><br>空转<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car idled in the driveway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆车停在行车道上, 引擎发动着。</font><br>\n

illusion	<h3>illusion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>错觉, 幻想, 错误观念<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun appears to go round the Earth, but it's an illu -sion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳看起来好像绕着地球转, 但这只是个错觉。</font><br>假象<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mirrors all round the walls give an illusion of greater space.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 墙壁周围的镜子造成一种较大空间的假象。</font><br>\n

immense	<h3>immense</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>极大的, 巨大的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made an immense improvement in English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在英语方面他们取得了巨大的进步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The expense of living is immense.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生活费用很庞大。</font><br>\n
imminent	<h3>imminent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(通常指不愉快的事)即将发生的, 逼近的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The black clounds show that a storm is imminent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乌云预示暴风雨即将来临。</font><br>\n
impatient	<h3>impatient</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不耐烦的, 急躁的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave another impatient glance at his watch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他又一次不耐烦地看了看他的表。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't get impatient about trivial thing like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要为那种琐事烦躁。</font><br>热切的, 急切的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's impatient for her father's arrival.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她急切地盼望着父亲的到来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was impatient to know what had happened to her son.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她急于想知道她儿子出了什么事。</font><br>\n
imperial	<h3>imperial</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>帝国的, 帝王的<br>英制的(度量衡)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The imperial gallon is not the same size as the US one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英制的加仑与美制的容量不同。</font><br>\n
implicit	<h3>implicit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不言明[含蓄]的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her silence gave implicit consent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的沉默表示默许。</font><br>无疑问的, 绝对的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A soldier must give implicit obedience to his officers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵必须绝对服从他的长官。</font><br>\n
imposing	<h3>imposing</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>庄严的, 仪表堂堂的, 令人印象深刻的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The castle is an imposing building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座城堡是一座宏伟的建筑。</font><br>\n
imprison	<h3>imprison</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>下狱, 监禁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They imprisoned many of those they caught.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把抓来的许多人关入了监狱。</font><br>\n

impulse	<h3>impulse</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>凭冲动行事, 突如其来的念头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He felt an irresistible impulse to rush into the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有一种难以抗拒的冲动想冲进房间。</font><br>推动, 冲力, 刺激, 推动力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plan will give an impulse to industrial expansion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个计划将促进工业的扩展。</font><br>\n
in	<h3>in</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…里面; 在, 于; 在…部位上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could feel the tension in the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以感觉到房间里的紧张气氛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They live in France.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们住在法国。</font><br>(表示时间)在…时期, 在…之后, 在过程中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In her twenties and thirties she had had no difficulty getting jobs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在二三十岁时找工作一点也不困难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I cannot see you now, come back in half an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在不能见你, 半小时后回来。</font><br>(表示方向)往…内, 朝…方向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw him go in the shop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看到他走进了商店。</font><br>(表示状态)处于…之中, 在…情况下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Martin was in his pyjamas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马丁穿着睡衣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were living in terrible poverty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们生活在极度贫困之中。</font><br>(表示方式)用, 以, 按, 乘, 以…形式<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were speaking in Italian.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在讲意大利语。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They went up in the lift.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们乘电梯上楼了。</font><br>(表示原因)由于, 为了<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went in fear of his life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为自己的性命担忧, 所以走了。</font><br>(表示领域, 范围)在…以内<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is not in my power to do that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 做那事非我力所能及。</font><br>(表示结果)当做, 作为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What did you give him in return?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你给他什么作为报答呢?</font><br>(表示目的)为了<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They set off in search of the lost child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们出发去寻找走失的孩子。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>进入, 入内<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door being opened, they came in at once.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门一打开, 他们就马上进来了。</font><br>在家, 在里面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My wife won't be in until five o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我妻子要到五点钟才在家。</font><br>到达, 来临<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the ship in yet?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船到港了吗?</font><br>当政, 当选<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This year the Conservative Party is in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今年保守党执政。</font><br>正当时令, 正当流行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Honey peaches are in now and we can eat them every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在水蜜桃正上市, 我们每天都可以吃到。</font><br>\n

incorporate	<h3>incorporate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>包含, 加上, 吸收<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shopping centre also incorporates a library and a bank.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商业中心还包括一家银行和一家图书馆。</font><br>把…合并, 使并入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to incorporate the company for tax reasons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于纳税的原因, 我们不得不把那家公司合并了。</font><br>组成公司<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When Smith's business became large, he incorporated it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当史密斯的业务扩大之后, 他把它组成了公司。</font><br>\n
incumbent	<h3>incumbent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>在职的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He defeated the incumbent governor by a large plurality.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以压倒多数票击败了现任州长。</font><br>义不容辞的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is incumbent upon us to do so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样做是我们义不容辞的责任。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>教区牧师<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man is an incumbent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位老人是一位教区牧师。</font><br>教会中的任职者<br>\n
incur	<h3>incur</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>遭受; 招致, 引起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He incurred a heavy loss through you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因为你而遭受重大损失。</font><br>\n

indirect	<h3>indirect</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>间接的, 迂回的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On the way home, we took an indirect route.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回家的路上, 我们绕了一个大圈。</font><br>不直截了当的, 婉转的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave only an indirect answer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他只作了间接的回答。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What he said was very indirect.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的话很婉转。</font><br>\n
indoor	<h3>indoor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>室内的, 户内的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a big indoor swimming pool in this hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家旅馆内有一个大的室内游泳馆。</font><br>\n
induce	<h3>induce</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>引诱, 劝导<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We induced him to come with us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们劝他与我们同行。</font><br>〈正〉引起, 导致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The medicine will induce sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种药使人入睡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her illness was induced by overwork.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的病是操劳过度引起的。</font><br>\n
indulge	<h3>indulge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>放纵, 容许<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is sometimes necessary to indulge a sick child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 迁就一个生病的小孩有时是必要的。</font><br>满足<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He would indulge her every dream.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他会尽量满足她的每一个奇思妙想。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>让自己尽情享受某物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn't say he's a drinker but he indulged at the party last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能说他是个酒鬼, 可是昨晚的晚会上, 他却不加节制地狂饮。</font><br>\n
industrialize	<h3>industrialize</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)工业化<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country has been steadily industrializing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该国正在稳步地实现工业化。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They wanted to industrialize their nation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们想使国家工业化。</font><br>\n

intact	<h3>intact</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>完整无缺的; 未经触动的; 未受损伤的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can scarcely survive this scandal with his reputation intact.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他经此丑闻名誉很难不受损。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The glasses remained intact after being dropped.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 眼镜坠地后依然完好无损。</font><br>\n
intake	<h3>intake</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>吸入, 纳入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The intake of gasoline was stopped by a clogged fuel line.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽油的注入由于管道阻塞而停止了。</font><br>(液体等)进入口<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Tornado jet fighter-bomber has two air intakes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旋风式喷气轰炸机有两个空气入口。</font><br>(一定时期内)进入或纳入的人数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Intake in state primary schools is down by 10%.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公立小学入学人数下降了10%。</font><br>\n
integrity	<h3>integrity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>正直; 诚实, 诚恳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a man of the highest integrity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个极其正直的人。</font><br>完整, 完全, 完善<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old Roman walls may still be seen but not in their integrity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 古罗马城墙尚可见, 但已残缺不全。</font><br>\n
intensify	<h3>intensify</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)增强, (使)加剧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drought has intensified.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旱情加剧了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blowing on fire intensifies the heat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吹火使热度加强。</font><br>\n
intensive	<h3>intensive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>加强的, 集中的, 密集的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll make an intensive study of a subject.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将集中学一门课程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Intensive care in hospital is given to the seriously ill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病情严重的人在医院里得到了精心的护理。</font><br>彻底的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His investigations were intensive and thorough but revealed nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他进行了深入彻底的调查, 但没有发现什么。</font><br>加强语气的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In “It's a bloody miracle!”, “bloody” is used as an intensive word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在“It's a bloody miracle!”一句中, bloody是用作加强语气的词。</font><br>\n
intent	<h3>intent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>意图, 意向, 目的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She behaved foolishly but with good intent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她表现得很愚蠢, 不过用心却是好的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>专心的, 专注的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was an intent look on her face as she watched the game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看比赛时脸上显示出专注的神色。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was intent on the job he was doing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他专心致志于正在做的工作。</font><br>意愿坚决的, 一心想…的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A merchant is intent on making money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商人热衷于赚钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's intent upon revenge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一心想报仇。</font><br>\n

interfere	<h3>interfere</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>干预; 调停<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have the right to interfere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有干预的权利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As he is always interfering, I told him to mind his own business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因为他常来指手画脚, 所以我让他少管闲事。</font><br>妨碍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you had not interfered, I should have finished my work by now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要不是你打扰我的话, 我现在早已完成了我的工作。</font><br>\n
interference	<h3>interference</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>干涉, 介入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wanted to do the thing on my own without outside interference or help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想独立完成这件事, 不受外界干扰, 也不要外来帮助。</font><br>阻碍, 干扰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn't hear the program because there was too much interference.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因干扰太大, 我听不清节目。</font><br>\n
intermediate	<h3>intermediate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>中间的; 中级的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This country is now at an intermediate stage of development.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家目前正处于发展的中间阶段。</font><br>\n

interrupt	<h3>interrupt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>打断<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children must learn not to interrupt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿童应学会不要打断别人的讲话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You'd better not interrupt him. He is sleeping.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你最好别打扰他, 他在睡觉。</font><br>\n
interval	<h3>interval</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>间隔时间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The interval between the two trees measures 40 feet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两棵树的间隔是40英尺。</font><br>幕间休息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audience were going out for the interval.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 幕间休息时观众走出了剧场。</font><br>\n
intervene	<h3>intervene</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>干涉, 干预; 调解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When riot broke out, the police were obliged to intervene.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发生暴乱时, 警察有责任干预。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are actively intervening to settle a quarrel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在积极调解争执。</font><br>干扰, 阻碍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will come if nothing intervenes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 若没有别的事, 我一定来。</font><br>\n
intimate	<h3>intimate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>亲密的, 密切的; 有性关系的(尤指婚外的)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is my intimate friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我的密友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Both felt that they had become very intimate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两人都感到了他们之间已变得非常亲密。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was intimate with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跟她有暧昧关系。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have long been intimate with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我和他相识已久。</font><br>私人的, 个人的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't tell them my intimate thoughts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能告诉他们我内心深处的想法。</font><br>详尽的, 精通的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is an intimate knowledge of African religions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一本关于非洲宗教的详尽知识的书。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>至交, 密友<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is my intimate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我的至交。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>示意, 暗示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He intimated his wishes with a slight nod of his head.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他微微点头示意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He intimated a wish to go by saying that it was late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说时间不早了, 暗示他该走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He intimated to do this work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他暗示他将做这项工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She intimated that she had a few words to say.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她示意有几句话要说。</font><br>\n

introduction	<h3>introduction</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>介绍, 引见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary was shy at her introduction to the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在向公司介绍自己时, 玛丽感到胆怯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With a smile, he makes introductions all round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他微笑着将在场的人一一作了介绍。</font><br>引言, 导论<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The introduction tells you how to use the book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 引言告诉你怎样使用这本书。</font><br>引进, 传入; 采用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He encouraged the introduction of new medical treatments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他鼓励采用新的医疗方法。</font><br>新采用的东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rabbit is a relatively recent introduction in Australia.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 兔子是相对较新引入澳大利亚的物种。</font><br>\n
invade	<h3>invade</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>侵入, 侵略<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ordered the army to invade at dawn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他命令军队在拂晓入侵。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>涌入, 侵袭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thousands of tourists invaded the old town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 数以千计的游客涌入那古老的镇上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The disease invades their bodies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 疾病侵袭了他们的身体。</font><br>侵犯, 干扰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The king invaded our private rights.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国王侵犯了我们的权利。</font><br>\n

irritate	<h3>irritate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使发怒, 使急躁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His words irritated me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的话使我很生气。</font><br>使感到不适, 使疼痛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rough material irritates the skin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 粗糙的料子会使皮肤难受。</font><br>\n
irritation	<h3>irritation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>激怒; 恼怒; 生气; 令人恼火的事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I felt a sudden irritation against Darren.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我突然对达伦感到气恼。</font><br>疼痛处; 疼痛感<br>\n

isolated	<h3>isolated</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>孤立的, 单独的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The radical group in the ruling party is becoming increasingly isolated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 执政党内的激进派日益孤立。</font><br>隔离的; 与世隔绝的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People with contagious diseases should be isolated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 传染病患者应予以隔离。</font><br>\n

jack	<h3>jack</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>千斤顶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lifted the car with a jack to change the flat tyre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用千斤顶把车顶起来换下瘪轮胎。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用千斤顶顶起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He jacked the car and changed the back tyre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用千斤顶把车顶起来更换后胎。</font><br>离开; 停止, 放弃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is going to jack this job in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她将辞掉这工作。</font><br>提高, 增加<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's time you jacked up my salary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你该给我增加工资了。</font><br>\n
jam	<h3>jam</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>果酱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The knives and forks were kept in a jam jar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刀叉原来放在一个果酱罐里。</font><br>拥挤, 堵塞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was such a jam of people that we couldn't get in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于人多拥挤, 我们无法进入。</font><br>困难的处境; 窘境<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's in an awful jam over his marriage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因婚事而陷入极大的困境。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)塞紧, (使)挤满<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shoppers jammed the stores at Christmas time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 圣诞节时购物的人挤满了商店。</font><br>发生故障; 夹住, 卡住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door has jammed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门卡住了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl jammed her hand when she closed the drawer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个女孩在关抽屉时夹了手。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>堵塞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The parade jammed traffic all over the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游行队伍阻塞了全市的交通。</font><br>(发射无线电波)干扰(信息, 节目)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were sent to jam the enemy's radio stations during the war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争期间他们被派去干扰敌人的电台。</font><br>\n
jar	<h3>jar</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>罐子, 广口瓶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The jar contained assorted hard candies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这罐子里装有什锦糖。</font><br>(啤酒)杯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's going down to the bar for a few jars tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打算明天去酒吧喝几杯啤酒。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>发出刺耳的声音<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chalk jarred against the blackboard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 粉笔在黑板上发出吱吱声。</font><br>不和谐; 不一致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try to avoid colours that jar when choosing curtains and rugs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选择窗帘和地毯时, 尽量避免颜色不调和。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使震动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fall jarred every bone in my body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那一跤摔得我浑身骨头酸痛。</font><br>\n

knight	<h3>knight</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(中古时代的)武士, 骑士<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Knight was the top title for field soldiers during the Middle Ages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 欧洲中世纪时期, 骑士是步兵中的最高头衔。</font><br>爵士<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was made an honourary knight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被授予荣誉爵士称号。</font><br>(国际象棋中)马, 有马头的棋子<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>封…为爵士<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr. John Smith was knighted by the Queen and became Sir John Smith.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰·史密斯先生被女王封为爵士, 成了约翰·史密斯爵士。</font><br>\n
knit	<h3>knit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>编结, 编织<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knits all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她整日编织毛线。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mother is knitting a sweater.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 母亲正在织毛衣。</font><br>(使)紧密地结合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A broken bone can knit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 碎骨可长合。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor knit the two broken bones in his arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生把他臂上的两块折骨接好了。</font><br>\n
knot	<h3>knot</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a knot in the rope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在绳子上打了个结。</font><br>一小群人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A knot of people stood talking outside the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一群人站在门外聊天。</font><br>硬节, 节瘤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A knot sometimes forms in a tired muscle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 疲乏的肌肉上有时会起硬块。</font><br>节, 海里/小时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The steamer makes 20 knots an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这艘轮船的时速是20海里。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)打结, 缠结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My thread has knotted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的线打起结来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knotted the parcel firmly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把那个小包扎得很紧。</font><br>\n

lag	<h3>lag</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>走得极慢; 落后<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child lagged because he was tired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子因累了而走得很慢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ten minutes later, some of runners in the race began to lag.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 十分钟后, 有些参赛的人开始落后了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lame child lagged behind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个跛脚的小孩落在后面了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If your payments of rent lag behind, you will be asked to leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你不如期交房租, 你就会被赶走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why does she always lag behind others when we're out for a walk?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为什么外出散步时, 她总落在后面?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Britain's economic development must lag behind that of almost every other industrial nation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英国的经济发展肯定落后于几乎所有的其他工业国。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>滞后, (时间上的)间隔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a time lag of about fifteen years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间上有一段约15年的间隔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This work must go forward without lag.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项工作必须毫不迟延地进行。</font><br>\n

leisure	<h3>leisure</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>空闲时间, 闲暇<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have not a moment's leisure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有一点空闲时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He read books at his leisure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在空闲时读一些书。</font><br>悠闲, 安逸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He likes leisure and hates work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他喜欢安逸, 讨厌工作。</font><br>\n

log	<h3>log</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>原木, 木材, 木料<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We transport logs by trains.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用火车运送木材。</font><br>航海[飞行]日志<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The captain described the accident in the ship's log.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船长在航海日志中描述了这件事。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>砍伐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They log for a living.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们以伐木为生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They logged the timber into 7-foot length.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把那根木材锯成七英尺长。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…记入航海日志<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He logged the ship's speed at 10 knots.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在航海日志之中记下船速每小时十海里。</font><br>航行(…距离), 飞行(…小时)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane logs 700 miles an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这架飞机以每小时700英里的时速飞行。</font><br>\n
logic	<h3>logic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>逻辑(学), 逻辑性<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He argues with learning and logic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的辩论既有学问又合逻辑。</font><br>推理方法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At this point our logic was at fault.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这一点上, 我们推理的方法是错误的。</font><br>合理的想法<br>\n
logical	<h3>logical</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>逻辑(上)的, 符合逻辑的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To be specific, the argument in your graduation thesis is logical.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 具体地说, 你的毕业论文符合逻辑。</font><br>推理正确的, 合乎常理的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is logical that the book is expensive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 书贵是很自然的事。</font><br>\n

long	<h3>long</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(距离, 长度)长的<br>长时间的, 长期的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's an hour long.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这有一个钟头之久。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pupils have two long holidays every year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学生们每年有两次长假。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>长久地, 长期地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you been working here long?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在这儿工作很久了吗?</font><br>很久地, 久远地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard about him long before I saw him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在没见过他之前就听说过他。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>长时间, 长时期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The work won't take long.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这工作不会花太长时间。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>渴望; 极想<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are longing to see you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们极想见到你。</font><br>\n

manoeuvre	<h3>manoeuvre</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>调动; 演习<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The grand manoeuvres will be held tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大规模的演习将于明天举行。</font><br>谨慎而熟练的动作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Inverted flight is an acrobatic manoeuvre of the plane.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 倒飞是飞机的一种特技动作。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使某物)移动, 运动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She manoeuvred her car into a difficult parking space.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把车子开进了一个不方便停车的地方。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>熟练而巧妙地引导<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They manoeuvred her into a marriage with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用计使她和他结婚。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>演习<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fleet is manoeuvring off the east coast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 舰队正在东海岸外演习。</font><br>\n

mansion	<h3>mansion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>宅第, 公馆; 大厦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old mansion was built in 1850.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座古宅建于1850年。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lives in Guilin Mansion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她住在桂林大厦。</font><br>\n
manual	<h3>manual</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>用手的, 手工的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The school offers manual training to the pupils.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该校为学生开设手工课。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>手册, 指南<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bought a manual of car repairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他买了一本汽车维修手册。</font><br>\n
manuscript	<h3>manuscript</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>手稿, 原稿, 底稿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a manuscript bearing as a title Ruth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一篇题为《鲁思》的手稿。</font><br>手写本<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a valuable medieval manuscript.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一本有价值的中世纪手抄本。</font><br>\n

marathon	<h3>marathon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈体〉马拉松赛跑(41.3km)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm hoping to be in the marathon next year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望明年能参加马拉松赛。</font><br>拖时长久令人难以忍受的事情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting was a bit of a marathon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次会议有点马拉松赛的味道。</font><br>\n
marble	<h3>marble</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大理石<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These steps are made of marble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些台阶是大理石的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a marble statue on the corner of the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 街的拐角处就有一大理石雕塑。</font><br>(用玻璃、泥等制成的)弹子<br>弹子游戏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's have a game of marbles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们玩弹球游戏吧。</font><br>\n

marginal	<h3>marginal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(印或记)在页边的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The marginal illustration is very interesting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 页边的插图很有趣。</font><br>不重要的, 微小的, 少量的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new law will have only a marginal effect on the lives of most people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新法律对大多数人的生活不会有重大的影响。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This once important social group is becoming more and more marginal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个一度十分重要的社会集团越来越无足轻重了。</font><br>仅以微弱多数票获胜的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He won the most marginal seat by only two votes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他只以两票的微弱优势当选。</font><br>\n
marshal	<h3>marshal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>元帅, 最高指挥官<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Zhukov was a marshal of the former Soviet Union.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 朱可夫是前苏联的一位元帅。</font><br>典礼官, 司仪<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The marshal rode at the head of the parade.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 典礼官在检阅队伍的前面骑马行进。</font><br>执法官, 警察局长; 消防局长<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was appointed fire marshal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被任命为消防队长</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>整理, 排列, 集结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The general marshaled his army for battle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将军集结部队准备战斗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Marshal your arguments before debating.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 辩论前整理一下你的论点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He marshaled his facts well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把事实列举得很好。</font><br>\n

marvellous	<h3>marvellous</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不可思议的, 惊奇的, 奇妙的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I warmly congratulated him on the marvellous achievement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我热烈祝贺他取得了惊人的成就。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's marvellous how he's managed to climb that far.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他怎么能爬得那么远, 真不可思议。</font><br>〈口〉极好的, 绝妙的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What you said is a marvellous idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你所说的真是个绝妙的主意。</font><br>\n

melt	<h3>melt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)融[溶, 熔]化; 溶解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ice will melt when the sun shines on it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当太阳照到冰的时候, 它就融化了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a story designed to melt the hardest heart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个铁石心肠也会感动的故事。</font><br>(使)消散, 消失<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't know where my money goes, it just seems to melt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道我的钱哪儿去了, 就像是消失了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They melted the nation's resources away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们使国家的资源逐渐枯竭。</font><br>\n

merge	<h3>merge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)混合, (使)合并<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two firms merged last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那两家商行去年合并了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two roads merge a mile ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两条路在前面一英里处会合。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The big company merged various small businesses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家大公司兼并了多家小商号。</font><br>\n
merit	<h3>merit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>功勋, 功劳; 价值<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He reached his present senior position through sheer merit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他全靠他的功绩才达到今天的地位。</font><br>长处, 优点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee are looking at the merits and demerits of the proposal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会正在评判该提议的优缺点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is great merit in dealing fairly with your employees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公正地对待你的雇员有极大好处。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>值得; 应获得<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think the suggestion merits consideration.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为这个建议值得考虑。</font><br>\n
metaphor	<h3>metaphor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>隐喻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Using metaphor, we say that computers have senses and a memory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打个比方, 我们可以说计算机有感觉和记忆力。</font><br>\n
meter	<h3>meter</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈美〉米<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 1.5 million cubic metres of earth were moved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 共搬运土方150万立方米。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This swimming certificate is to certify that I swim one hundred metres.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这张游泳证证明我可以游100米。</font><br>计, 表, 仪表<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man from the gas board came to read the gas meter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 煤气公司派来的人来查煤气表的读数。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The amount of electricity used is recorded by a meter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电表记录下耗电量。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用仪表测量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She metered it and found it to be the exact size.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用仪器测量了一下, 发现正好是这个尺寸。</font><br>\n
metropolitan	<h3>metropolitan</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>大都会的, 大城市的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Metropolitan residents are used to fast rhythm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大都市的居民习惯于快节奏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Metropolitan buildings become taller than ever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大城市的建筑变得比以前更高。</font><br>中心地区的, 正宗的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Canadian French is different from the language of metropolitan France.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加拿大的法语与法国本土的法语不相同。</font><br>\n
microphone	<h3>microphone</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>扩音器, 麦克风<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The singer used a microphone so that every one in the hall could hear him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 歌手用了麦克风, 以便大厅里的每一个人都能听得见。</font><br>\n

migrate	<h3>migrate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>迁移; 移往<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pioneers from New England migrated to all parts of the United States.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 来自新英格兰的拓荒者移居到美国各地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These birds migrate northwards in spring and southwards in fall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些鸟春天向北迁徙, 秋天向南迁徙。</font><br>\n

mine	<h3>mine</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>(I的所有格)我的(东西)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That's your coat; mine is here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是你的上衣, 我的在这儿。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>矿, 矿井<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The inspector went down the mine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 监察员已下到矿井里了。</font><br>地雷; 水雷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An engineer tried to detonate the mine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一名工程师试图引爆地雷。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>在…中开采, 开采<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are mining for coal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在开采煤矿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They'd mined the hillside for the ores.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们曾在这个小山坡上开采矿石。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>在…中[下]布雷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They've mined the entrance to the harbour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在港口布了雷。</font><br>以地雷[水雷]炸毁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their ship was mined.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的船被水雷炸毁了。</font><br>\n

miniature	<h3>miniature</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>小型的, 微小的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child was playing with his miniature train.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个孩子在玩他的小火车。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>微型复制品, 微小模型<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have a detailed miniature of the Titanic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有一个“泰坦尼克”号的精细模型。</font><br>微型画, 微型人像画<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The art of portrait miniatures was originated in England.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 微型画像艺术创始于英国。</font><br>\n
minimal	<h3>minimal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>〈正式〉最小的; 极少的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The storm did only minimal damage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风雨只造成极轻微的损失。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I stayed with friends, so my expenses were minimal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我住在朋友家, 所以我的花费很小。</font><br>\n
minimize	<h3>minimize</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…减至最低数量[程度]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can minimize the dangers of driving by taking care to obey the rules of the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 严格遵守交通规则, 你就能把行车危险降到最低点。</font><br>对(某事物)作最低估计; 极力贬低(某事物)的价值[重要性]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He minimized the value of her contribution to his research so that he got all the praise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他极力贬低她在那项研究中的贡献, 从而独获全部奖励。</font><br>\n

mint	<h3>mint</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>铸币厂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mint makes coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 铸币厂制造硬币。</font><br>巨额(的钱)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a mint of money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有的是钱。</font><br>薄荷<br>薄荷糖<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>铸造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Romans learned to mint from the Greeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罗马人从希腊人那里学会了铸造钱币。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The silver which was mined there was minted into coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那里开采的银子被用来铸成钱币。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>创造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've just minted a new word!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我刚造了一个新词！</font><br>\n
minus	<h3>minus</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示否定)没有, 缺少, 差<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The statue survived through minus a leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雕像幸存了下来, 缺了一条腿。</font><br>(表示运算)减去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Five minus three is two.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 五减三等于二。</font><br>(表示数目)在零度以下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The temperature was minus 30 degrees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 气温为零下30度。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>减号, 负号<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plus sign is used in addition and the minus is used in subtraction.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加号用于加法; 减号用于减法。</font><br>不利, 不足, 缺点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's consider the pluses and minuses of moving house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们考虑一下搬家的利弊吧。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>负的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Twelve from ten equals minus two.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 10减去12等于负2。</font><br>不利的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's keen, but his youth is a minus factor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他非常精明, 但他的年轻却是个不利的因素。</font><br>略低于某标准的<br>\n

miserable	<h3>miserable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>悲惨的, 不幸的, 可怜的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have led a miserable life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们过了一段悲惨的生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her past life was miserable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她过去的生活很苦。</font><br>令人痛苦的; 令人不快的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They started their holiday on a miserable day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们假期开始时天气很不好。</font><br>低劣的; 贫乏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was born in a miserable family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出身于一个贫困的家庭。</font><br>卑鄙的, 可耻的, 可恶的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What a miserable old devil he was!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是多么可恶的吝啬鬼呀！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was miserable of you to make fun of him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你取笑他, 这是可耻的。</font><br>\n
misery	<h3>misery</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>痛苦, 苦恼, 苦难<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The family lived in misery for several years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家人过了几年的痛苦生活。</font><br>痛苦的事, 不幸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm suffering the miseries of unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我正为失业而痛苦。</font><br>常发牢骚的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You old misery!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你这个爱抱怨的老家伙！</font><br>\n

mist	<h3>mist</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>薄雾<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The towers were shrouded in mist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 城楼被蒙上薄雾。</font><br>视线模糊不清<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hills were shrouded in mist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 群山被蒙上薄雾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She saw his face through a mist of tears.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她泪眼朦胧地望着他的脸。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)蒙上薄雾, (使)模糊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It isn't raining, it's only mist-ing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没下雨, 只是下雾了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tears misted her eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 眼泪使她的双眼模糊了。</font><br>\n

mistress	<h3>mistress</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>主妇, 女主人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is your mistress at home?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你家女主人在家吗?</font><br>情妇<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does his wife know he has a mistress?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的妻子知道他有一个情妇吗?</font><br>\n
moan	<h3>moan</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>呻吟; 悲叹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sick woman moaned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位生病的女人在呻吟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prisoner moaned a prayer for help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 囚犯呻吟着祈求帮助。</font><br>抱怨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's always moaning that she has too much work to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是抱怨她有太多的事要做。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>呻吟声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp From time to time there was a moan of pain from the sick man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病人不时发出一声声痛苦的呻吟。</font><br>抱怨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They get fed up with her moans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的抱怨令他们感到厌烦。</font><br>\n
mob	<h3>mob</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>暴徒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An angry mob is attacking the palace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 愤怒的暴徒在攻击王宫。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>聚众包围<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fans mobbed the actor where he went.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位演员走到哪里, 影迷们都围着他。</font><br>\n
mobilize	<h3>mobilize</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>动员起来, 调动, 鼓动起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The troops received orders to mobilize.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部队接到动员令。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is trying to mobilize all the supporters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正在竭力把所有的支持者动员起来。</font><br>\n
mock	<h3>mock</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>愚弄; 嘲弄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went to church only to mock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他去教堂只想嘲笑宗教。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She mocked him as a country boy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她嘲笑他是个乡下孩子。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使受挫折<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The strong fortress mocked the invaders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 坚固的堡垒使入侵者无法攻入。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>仿制的; 模拟的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The students have done mock A levels at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学生们在学校参加过模拟高级考试。</font><br>\n

multiply	<h3>multiply</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>乘, (使)相乘<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His son is learning to multiply and divide.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他儿子正在学习乘法和除法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One can make 18 by multiplying 3 and 6 (together).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以3和6相乘可得18。</font><br>(使)增加<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Spending on military equipment has multiplied in the last five years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过去的五年中军事装备的开支大大增加。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His experience was multiplied as the years passed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随着岁月的流逝, 他的经验丰富了。</font><br>(使)繁殖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When animals have more food, they generally multiply faster.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 动物在有较多的食物时, 一般繁殖得较快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hot weather multiplied the bacteria in milk rapidly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 炎热的天气使牛奶中的细菌迅速繁殖。</font><br>\n

murmur	<h3>murmur</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>低沉、连续而不清的声音<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In our room we could hear the murmur of a distant brook.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我们房间能听到远处小溪汩汩的流水声。</font><br>低语声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a murmur of conversation in the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 屋里传来一阵轻轻的谈话声。</font><br>怨言, 嘀咕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They paid the extra taxes without a murmur.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们毫无怨言地交了附加税。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>小声说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is murmuring to himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在自言自语。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child murmured something in his sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子在睡梦中喃喃地说着什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As she denounced the government's policy, the crowd murmured their approval.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当她抨击政府的政策时, 听众叽叽咕咕地表示赞同。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He leant towards me and murmured that he had to leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他靠近我, 并小声告诉我他要离开。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>发出连续而低沉的声音<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind murmured in the trees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风在林中低鸣。</font><br>私下低声抱怨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The workers murmured at the treatment they received.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人们因不满意他们所受的待遇而发牢骚。</font><br>\n
muscular	<h3>muscular</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(有关)肌(肉)的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a muscular strain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他肌肉过劳。</font><br>肌肉发达的, 强壮的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a muscular young man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个健壮的年轻人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The player is tall and muscular.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那名运动员身高力大。</font><br>\n
muse	<h3>muse</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>缪斯<br>艺术家的创作灵感<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His muse had deserted him, and he could no longer write.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已无灵感, 不能再写作了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>沉思; 冥想<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>沉思自语说(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “I wonder if I shall ever see them again, ”he mused.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “我不知道是否还可以再见到他们, ”他沉思自问。</font><br>\n
mushroom	<h3>mushroom</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>蘑菇<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some mushrooms are good to eat; some are poisonous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些蘑菇可食用, 有些则有毒。</font><br>如蘑菇般生长迅速的事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Birmingham is a mushroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伯明翰是个迅猛发展的城市。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mushroom development of technology will pave the way for improving our economy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 科学技术的迅猛发展将为我们改善经济状况铺平道路。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>迅速成长[发展]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp New housing estates have mushroomed on the edge of the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 城郊的新住宅楼发展得十分迅速。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The little town mushroomed into a city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那座小镇迅速发展成一座城市。</font><br>成蘑菇状扩散<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smoke mushroomed into the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烟呈蘑菇状升上天空。</font><br>\n
mute	<h3>mute</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>缄默的; 无声的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave me her hand with mute thanks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她向我伸手表示无言的谢意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The class remained mute when the teacher asked a difficult question.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师问到难题时, 全班都沉默无言。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is mute on the subject of social system.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对社会制度的问题保持沉默。</font><br>哑的, 不会说话的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy is mute and deaf.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这男孩既聋又哑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child has been mute since birth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子从生下来就不能讲话。</font><br>(字母)不发音的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The word “debt” contains a mute letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在debt这个词中有一个不发音的字母。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>哑巴<br>(乐器上的)弱音器<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>消除(声音), 减轻(声音)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The strings are muted throughout the closing bars of the symphony.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该交响曲结束部分各节中的弦乐全为弱化音。</font><br>\n
mutter	<h3>mutter</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>轻声低语; 咕哝地抱怨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't mutter when they are studying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他们学习时不要轻声低语。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new soldier muttered about the food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位新士兵咕哝地抱怨吃得不好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She muttered a threat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她低声恐吓。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>轻声低语, 小声抱怨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spoke in a mutter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他嘀嘀咕咕轻声说话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard a mutter of discontent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听到有人小声咕哝着表示不满。</font><br>\n
mysterious	<h3>mysterious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>神秘的; 难以理解的<br>诡秘的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His action was very mysterious.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的行动十分神秘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was very mysterious in his manner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的行为举止十分神秘。</font><br>\n
nadir	<h3>nadir</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>天底<br>最低点; 最压抑、消沉等的时刻<br>\n
nail	<h3>nail</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>钉子, 钉状物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drove in a nail with one stroke of the hammer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一锤就把钉子敲进去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Magnets attract nails.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 磁铁吸引铁钉。</font><br>指甲, 趾甲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have tried to discourage him from biting nails.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我曾劝阻他不要咬指甲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My nails are too long, I must file them down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的指甲太长了, 必须把它们锉平。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>钉住, 钉牢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He nailed boards together to make a box.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把几块木板钉在一起做了一个箱子。</font><br>抓住, 逮住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has the police nailed the man?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察抓住那个人了吗?</font><br>\n
naive	<h3>naive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>幼稚的; 无经验的; 单纯的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's naive of you to believe he'll do what he says.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 相信他会言行一致, 你未免太单纯了。</font><br>天真的; 轻信的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't be so naive as to be taken in by their lies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要太轻信, 以免被他们的谎言所欺骗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is so naive that she believes everything he tells her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她如此天真以致相信他告诉她的一切。</font><br>\n
naked	<h3>naked</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>裸露的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Naked bathing is not allowed to this beach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个海滩禁止裸泳。</font><br>赤裸裸的, 无遮蔽的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To the east of our school, there's a naked hillside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们学校东边有片光秃秃的山坡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Beneath them the earth was naked of grass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在他们脚下是寸草不生的土地。</font><br>不加掩饰的; 坦白的, 明显的<br>\n
namely	<h3>namely</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>即, 也就是<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only one boy was absent, namely Harry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有一个孩子缺席, 就是哈利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He could not do anything more than what he promised —namely, to look after Charlotte's estate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他只能做到自己答应的事, 那就是照看夏洛蒂的产业。</font><br>\n
