narrative	<h3>narrative</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>记叙文; 故事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His trip through the world made an interesting narrative.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他周游世界的旅行是个很有趣的故事。</font><br>叙述, 讲述; 叙述部分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In narrative, the reporting verb is in the past tense.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在叙述过程中, 间接引语的动词通常用过去式。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Narrative makes up most of the book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书的大部分篇幅都是叙述性的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>叙述的; 叙事体的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was a writer of great narrative power.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一位颇有记述能力的作家。</font><br>\n
NASA	<h3>NASA</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>abbr.</i></font><br>National Aeronautics and Space Administration <美>国家航空和宇宙航行局<br>\n
NASA	<h3>NASA</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>abbr.</i></font><br>National Aeronautics and Space Administration 〈美〉国家航空和宇宙航行局<br>\n
nasty	<h3>nasty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>令人讨厌的; 令人厌恶的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try to get rid of your nasty cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 想法除去你那讨厌的感冒。</font><br>恶意的; 恶毒的; 卑鄙的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The joke is a nasty hit at him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个玩笑对他而言是个恶毒的讽刺。</font><br>严重的; 危险的; 造成痛苦的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got a nasty knock on the head when she fell.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她跌倒时头部受到严重碰撞。</font><br>下流的, 道德败坏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They'd be laughing making nasty remarks, and make passes at her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们会笑着说下流话, 并对她非礼。</font><br>\n
nationalism	<h3>nationalism</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>爱国主义; 爱国心<br>民族主义<br>\n
nationality	<h3>nationality</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>国籍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lives in France but has British nationality.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她住在法国但拥有英国国籍。</font><br>民族群体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A lot of national parks lie in the areas inhabited by minority nationality people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多国家公园都位于少数民族聚居的地方。</font><br>\n
nationwide	<h3>nationwide</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj. & adv.</i></font><br>全国范围的; 全国性的; 在全国<br>\n
necessity	<h3>necessity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>必要(性); (迫切)需要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must understand the necessity of education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须懂得教育的必要性。</font><br>必需品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Telephone is now a household necessity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在电话是一种家庭必需品。</font><br>自然规律<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is it a logical necessity that higher wages will lead to higher prices?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工资高物价就高, 这是合乎逻辑的必然规律吗?</font><br>\n
needle	<h3>needle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>针<br>针状物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pine needles were still quivering.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 松针还在抖动着。</font><br>\n
neglect	<h3>neglect</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>疏忽; 忽略; 遗漏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government neglected industry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府忽视了工业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect your health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要忽视你的健康。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It won't do to neglect this work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 忽视这项工作是不行的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No country can afford to neglect education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 任何国家都不能忽视教育。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For a time he neglected his studies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一段时间, 他放松了学习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't trust him for he often neglects his duty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不信任他, 因为他常玩忽职守。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is bad for us to pay attention to one side and neglect the other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只顾一方面, 不顾其他方面, 会对我们不利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wrong was neglected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种错误被忽略了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of the most significant issues were neglected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最重要的问题中, 有些被忽略了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The study of this subject is undeservedly neglected today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现今, 这门学科的研究受到不应有的忽视。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The great importance of the quality of equipment for navigation should never be neglected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 导航设备的质量极为重要, 不容忽视。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect to study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要疏忽学习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He neglected to follow the instructions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他疏忽了, 未遵循指示。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He neglected to write and say “Thank you”.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忘了写信道谢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They neglected to lay a good foundation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没有注意打下了一个良好的基础。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect to lock the door when you leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你离开时别忘了锁门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He neglected to mention that compensation should be made for all the damage done to the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忘了提出对该建筑物造成的损失均应赔偿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She neglected locking the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她忘记锁门了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect writing to your mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要忘了给你母亲写信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He neglected calling Tom to school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忘了叫汤姆上学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect paying him a visit now and then.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别忘了时常去看看他。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>忽略, 疏忽, 玩忽<br>被忽略的状态<br>\n
negotiator	<h3>negotiator</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>谈判代表<br>\n
neighbourhood	<h3>neighbourhood</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>地区; 某地区的人; 与某处邻近的地区<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are neighbourhood paper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它们属于同一区域的报纸。</font><br>\n

nest	<h3>nest</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(鸟)窝, 巢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The swallows are building a nest under the roof of our house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 燕子正在我们的屋檐下筑巢。</font><br>(某些动物或昆虫的)窝, 穴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is an ants' nest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个蚁穴。</font><br>温床, 庇护所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The palace was a nest of intrigue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座宫殿曾是阴谋诡计的策源地。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>筑巢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most birds nest in a tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多数鸟在树上筑巢。</font><br>\n

noble	<h3>noble</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>高尚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a noble man, we all admire him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一个道德高尚的人, 我们都敬佩他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His attempt to save the poor people's homes was truly noble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拯救穷人家园的尝试确实非常高尚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was very noble of you to look after your old neighbour when she was sick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的心真好, 你的老邻居生病时你一直照料她。</font><br>雄伟的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Niagara falls is a noble sight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尼亚加拉瀑布是一壮观的景色。</font><br>贵族的, 显贵的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was descended from a noble family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出身于贵族家庭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was nobler than his neighbours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他比他的邻居出身高贵。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>贵族<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the nobles rebelled, the king battled them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当贵族谋反时, 国王便出兵攻打他们。</font><br>\n
noisy	<h3>noisy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>嘈杂的; 喧闹的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish those noisy children would sober down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望那些闹哄哄的孩子们静下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's very noisy in this office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个办公室里十分喧闹。</font><br>\n
nominal	<h3>nominal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>名义上的, 有名无实的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The king was only the nominal head of the state.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国王只是这个国家名义上的元首。</font><br>(金额)很少的; 象征性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The settler got the house at a nominal price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 移居者象征性地花点钱买下了这栋房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The charge of the box lunch was nominal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 午餐盒饭收费很少。</font><br>\n
nominate	<h3>nominate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>提名…为候选人; 任命<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I nominate John.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我推荐约翰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I nominate Bill as the club president.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我提名比尔为俱乐部主席候选人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President nominated me his representative at the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统任命我为他的代表出席会议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I nominate Tom to make the tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我指派汤姆去沏茶。</font><br>\n

noon	<h3>noon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>正午; 中午<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It approached noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时已正午。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Prime Minister is scheduled to arrive at noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 首相定于中午到达。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rocket is due to lift off at noon on Friday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火箭定于星期五中午发射。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The marines landed at noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海军陆战队在中午登陆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judge handed his decision down at noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官中午下了判决。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The goods will be delivered at noon tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 明天中午交货。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you guarantee to get these before noon?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能保证在中午之前弄到这些吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By noon, all 61 people were judged out of danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到中午时, 61个人看来都脱离危险了。</font><br>\n
norm	<h3>norm</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>标准, 规范<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Of his age, the child is above the norm in arithmetic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在他那个年龄, 这个孩子的算术能力是超过标准的。</font><br>准则, 行为模式<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone should abide by our social norms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们每个人都应该遵守社会行为准则。</font><br>\n

nowadays	<h3>nowadays</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>现在; 现时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nowadays people like travelling on foot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在人们喜欢徒步旅行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nowadays petrol costs too much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今的汽油太贵了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's much thinner nowadays than he used to be;  I think he's been ill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近他比以前瘦多了, 我想他一直在生病。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cars go very fast nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今的汽车跑得快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Antiques are much sought after nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在求购古玩成风。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most films are colour ones nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在大多数影片是彩色的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The novels of Scott are much in demand nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 斯科特的小说目前十分畅销。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can see many adulterators in the market nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时下我们能见到有许多低劣商品冲击市场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many shoes nowadays are made of plastic or similar stuff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今, 许多鞋子是用塑料或类似的材料制成的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't set up a business nowadays without money behind you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现如今你要是没有钱在后边撑着, 就办不成事。</font><br>\n

obligation	<h3>obligation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>义务; 责任<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His social obligation compels him to make a round of visits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的社会职责使得他不得不进行一系列访问。</font><br>\n
oblige	<h3>oblige</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>迫使做; 使负义务<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'd be happy to oblige.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们乐于效劳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Poverty obliged her to live a hard life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贫困迫使她过艰苦的生活。</font><br>满足请求; 施惠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry, I can't oblige you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很抱歉, 我不能帮你的忙。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>感激<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I should be obliged if you wouldn't say so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果不这样说, 我就感谢你了。</font><br>\n
obscure	<h3>obscure</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不出名的; 不重要的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are many minor and obscure poets in the age of Elizabeth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伊丽莎白时代有许多不知名的诗人。</font><br>费解的; 模糊不清的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The point of his speech is obscure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发言的要点模糊不清。</font><br>不易看清的, 暗淡的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room is too obscure for reading.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这房间太昏暗了, 无法看书。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使…模糊不清; 掩盖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her poor English obscured her meaning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的英语差, 难以表达自己的意思。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My view was obscured by the trees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的视线被树挡住了。</font><br>\n
observation	<h3>observation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>注意; 观察<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new breed is under observation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新品种正在观察中。</font><br>观察力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a student of keen observation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一个观察力敏锐的学生。</font><br>言论, 评论, 意见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made valuable observations on the prices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对物价问题提出了宝贵的意见。</font><br>观察资料, 观察数据<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's just published observations on Japanese bird life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他刚刚发表了关于日本鸟类生活的观察资料。</font><br>\n
obsess	<h3>obsess</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>时刻困扰; 缠住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fear of death obsessed him throughout his old life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他晚年一直受着死亡恐惧的困扰。</font><br>\n
obsession	<h3>obsession</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>困扰, 无法摆脱的思想(或情感)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With him, gambling is an obsession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对于他来说, 赌博是无法摆脱的。</font><br>\n
obstacle	<h3>obstacle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>障碍(物), 妨碍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt that her family was an obstacle to her work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感到她的家庭妨碍她的工作。</font><br>\n

outing	<h3>outing</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>远足, 郊游, 短途旅行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We went for an outing that included a picnic and a volleyball game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们出去做了一次包括野餐和排球比赛的远足。</font><br>\n
outlaw	<h3>outlaw</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>歹徒, 亡命之徒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The outlaw has been caught.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 歹徒已被抓住了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>宣布…为不合法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most states have outlawed the use of marijuana.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数州都宣布使用大麻为非法行为。</font><br>\n
outlet	<h3>outlet</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>出口, 出路<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The outlet of a water pipe was blocked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水管的出水口堵住了。</font><br>发泄的途径<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Running is a good outlet for his energy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 跑步是他发泄过剩精力的好方法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He needs an outlet for his pent-up anger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的满腔怒火需要有机会发泄。</font><br>经销店<br>\n
outlook	<h3>outlook</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>景色, 景致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have a good outlook from my bedroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的卧室有很好的窗景。</font><br>观点; 见解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a broad outlook on life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的人生观十分豁达。</font><br>展望; 前景<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The outlook for the economy is bright.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经济前景光明。</font><br>\n
outrage	<h3>outrage</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>义愤, 愤慨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he heard the news he reacted with a sense of outrage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他得悉此事时义愤填膺。</font><br>暴行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The use of H-bombs would be an outrage against humanity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 使用氢弹是违反人道的暴行。</font><br>骇人听闻的事件<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>引起…的义愤, 激怒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is an act that outrages public opinion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是违反民意的做法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Members of Parliament were outraged by the news of the assassination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 议会议员们被这暗杀的消息激怒了。</font><br>\n
outrageous	<h3>outrageous</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>骇人的; 残暴的; 无耻的; 不道德的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her outrageous behaviour at the party offended everyone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在聚会上的无礼行为触怒了每一个人。</font><br>\n
outright	<h3>outright</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>完全地; 彻底地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should persuade her to marry you outright.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该彻底劝服她嫁给你。</font><br>坦率地; 直率地; 无保留地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you have a complaint you should tell me outright.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你有不满意的事, 你应该直率地对我说。</font><br>立即, 当场<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three people were killed outright in the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事故中一下死了三个人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>完全的; 彻底的<br>\n
outset	<h3>outset</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>开始, 开端<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I warned you at the outset not to trust him, and you wouldn't listen to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一开始我就警告过你不要信任他, 可你不肯听我的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was not here at the outset of the experiment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 实验开始时他不在这里。</font><br>\n

overhead	<h3>overhead</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>离地面的; 头顶上的; 上空的, 架空的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The overhead bird flew away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 头上的鸟飞走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many stars overhead are invisible to the naked eye.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天上的许多星星是肉眼看不到的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在头顶上; 在空中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A plane flew overhead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一架飞机从空中飞过。</font><br>在楼上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The people in the room overhead were very noisy yesterday evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚在楼上那个房间的人很吵。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(企业的)经费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Heavy overheads reduced his profits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经费开支大因而减少了他的利润。</font><br>\n
overlap	<h3>overlap</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>部分重叠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His duties and mine overlap.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的任务和我的任务有重叠。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tiles overlap each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 屋瓦相互叠盖。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>重叠的部分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The overlap between the jacket and the trousers is not good.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夹克和裤子重叠的部分不好看。</font><br>\n

overthrow	<h3>overthrow</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>打倒;  推翻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stumbled and overthrew the chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他绊了一下, 撞翻了椅子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They overthrew their King.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们推翻了国王。</font><br>使终止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has overthrown the basic standards of morality.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已摒弃了基本的道德标准。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>推翻; 终止, 结束<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the overthrow of the government, the country was in chaos.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府被推翻后, 这个国家处于混乱中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The revolution caused the overthrow of the autocracy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场革命导致了独裁政体的结束。</font><br>\n

parade	<h3>parade</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)集合接受检阅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The colonel paraded his troops.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上校检阅自己的部队。</font><br>游行; 列队行进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army paraded round drill squares.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 军队绕训练场列队行进。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>展示; 炫耀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is parading his knowledge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在炫耀他的知识。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(部队的)检阅<br>游行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Olympic Games began with a parade of all the competing nations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 奥运会以所有参赛国列队进场开始。</font><br>\n
paradise	<h3>paradise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>天堂, 天国<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parts of California seem like paradise to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加利福尼亚的一些地区对我来说就像天堂一样。</font><br>伊甸园<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Adam and Eve dwelt in paradise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 亚当和夏娃生活在伊甸园里。</font><br>理想[完美]的地方, 乐园, 乐土<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These forests are a hunter's paradise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这片森林是猎人的乐园。</font><br>完美快乐的境界, 至福, 极乐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Being alone is her idea of paradise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她认为一人独处最美。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's sheer paradise to relax in a hot bath after a hard day's work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一天的辛苦工作之后在热水浴缸中松弛一下真是最大的享受。</font><br>\n
paragraph	<h3>paragraph</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>段落<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Each paragraph begins on a new line.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每段都另起一行。</font><br>短篇报道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's a paragraph on the matter in the paper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报纸对这件事有一短篇报道。</font><br>\n
parallel	<h3>parallel</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(指至少两条线)平行的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are two parallel lines.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这有两条平行线。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These two roads are parallel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两条路是平行的。</font><br>类似的; 相对应的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the parallel points in the characters of different men.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就是不同人物间个性上的类似之处。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The growth of the two towns was almost parallel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两个城镇的发展几乎相同。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>平行线[面]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This line is a parallel with that one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条线和那条线平行。</font><br>极相似的人[事物]<br>类似(点), 相似(之处)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are some interesting parallels between the educational systems of these two countries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两国的教育制度之间有些有趣的相似之处。</font><br>比较<br>纬线, 纬圈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This city is close to the fortieth parallel of north latitude.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个城市靠近北纬40度。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>与…平行; 与…相当<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The street parallels the railway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条街与铁路平行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No one has paralleled his successful business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人赶得上他在事业上的成就。</font><br>\n
parcel	<h3>parcel</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>包裹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am going to take the parcel to the post office this afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天下午我打算去邮局寄包裹。</font><br>一块地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This parcel of land consists of 18 acres.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这片土地有18英亩。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>给…打成包裹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sales clerk parceled his purchase.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 售货员把他买的东西打成包裹。</font><br>分成若干部分<br>\n
pardon	<h3>pardon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>宽恕, 原谅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She asked him to pardon her rudeness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她请求他原谅她的无礼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope you'll pardon me saying so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 希望你原谅我这么说。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>饶恕, 原谅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At last, he obtained his father's pardon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他终于得到了父亲的原谅。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I beg your pardon, what you say is not exactly correct.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起, 你说的话并不完全对。</font><br>赦免<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His pardon came through only three hours before he was due to be executed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在他要被处死之前三个小时传来了对他的赦免。</font><br>\n

peach	<h3>peach</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>桃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pulled a peach from the tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从树上摘下一只桃。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My granny likes eating tinned peaches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我奶奶喜欢吃桃罐头。</font><br>桃树<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are two peaches in our yard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的院子里有两棵桃树。</font><br>〈口〉美人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's a real peach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她真是个美人。</font><br>〈口〉(同类事物中)极好的[极吸引人的]事物<br>\n
pearl	<h3>pearl</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>珍珠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The necklace consists of three strings of pearls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条项链由三串珍珠组成。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bought his girlfriend a pearl necklace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给他女朋友买了一条珍珠项链。</font><br>珠状物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pearls of dew glistened on the grass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 草地上露珠晶莹剔透。</font><br>珍品<br>\n
peasant	<h3>peasant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>农民, 农夫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father is a peasant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他父亲是一位农民。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They supplied large numbers of tractors to peasants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们向农民供应了大批拖拉机。</font><br>\n
peculiar	<h3>peculiar</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>奇怪的, 异常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wine has a peculiar taste.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种酒有种怪怪的味道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He looked at me with a very peculiar expression.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用一种很奇怪的表情看着我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's always been a little peculiar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为人总是有点儿古怪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My books have disappeared—it's most peculiar!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的书不见了——这可太奇怪了！</font><br>特有的, 独具的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book has a peculiar value.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书有特殊的价值。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Language is peculiar to mankind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 语言是人类所特有的。</font><br>〈非正〉不舒服, 有病的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Seeing blood makes me feel a bit peculiar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看见血会使我感到有点儿不舒服。</font><br>\n

pencil	<h3>pencil</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>铅笔, 彩色铅笔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pens and pencils are writing utensils.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 钢笔和铅笔是书写工具。</font><br>光线锥<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That is a pencil of rays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是一束光线。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用铅笔写、画或标记(某物)<br>\n
pending	<h3>pending</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>直到, 在等待…期间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp None of the four people killed was identified pending (the) notification of relatives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 四个被害者身份尚未确定, 正待亲人前来辨认。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>未决的, 未定的, 待定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lawsuit is still pending in the state court.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这案子仍在州法庭等待定夺。</font><br>即将发生的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our mid-term exam is pending.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们就要期中考试了。</font><br>\n
penetrate	<h3>penetrate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>穿过, 刺入, 渗入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The knife penetrated his finger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刀子刺入他的手指。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water penetrated the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水渗入房间里。</font><br>了解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She could penetrate what I was thinking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她了解我在想什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard what you said, but it didn't penetrate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的话我听见了, 但是没有听懂。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>看穿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He penetrated our thoughts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看穿了我们的心思。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The spy's disguise was soon penetrated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 间谍的伪装不久便被识破了。</font><br>\n

perceive	<h3>perceive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>感觉, 察觉, 理解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has perceived the danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已觉察到那危险了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They perceived the faults of their own children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们知道了他们自己儿女的过失。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't perceive any difference between these coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看不出这些硬币的区别。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you perceive a red colour or a green one?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看出来是红颜色还是绿颜色?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That rule is not easily perceived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条规则不容易理解。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Such fallacies are not easily perceived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 识别这种谬论并非易事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They perceived that they were unwelcome and left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们意识到他们是不受欢迎的, 于是就离开了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I perceived that I could not make him change his mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我意识到我不能使他改变主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They perceived that the enemy was trying to wear down their resistance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们明白敌人是想用消耗的办法来制服他们的抵抗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can easily perceive what he wants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可轻而易举地看出他要什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He perceived what the shy little man wanted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看出了这个害羞的小人想要什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We perceive him wish to make progress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们看得出他是要求进步的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I plainly perceive some objections remain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我清楚地察觉到还有一些反对意见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You are perceived to accept his offer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人得知, 你要接受他的条件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thief was perceived to steal into the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人看见小偷溜进那房子里去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you perceive anyone entering the laboratory?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看见有人进入实验室吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They perceived a stranger wandering in the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们看到一个陌生人在花园里闲逛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We perceived a little girl coming toward us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们发觉一个小女孩正朝我们这边走来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was perceived dancing alone in her room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人看见她正在自己的房子里独自起舞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Soon the boy perceived the snake to be a dead one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 男孩很快发觉那条蛇是死的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On entering his house, we at once perceived him to be tasteful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一进他的房子, 立刻感觉到他是个高品位的人。</font><br>\n

persist	<h3>persist</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>坚持, 固执<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On the tops of very high mountains snow persists throughout the year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 高山顶上, 积雪终年不化。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bad weather will persist all over the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种坏天气将在全国各地持续下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His strength of will enabled him to persist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的意志力使他能坚持下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tendency still persists.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种倾向一直存在。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He persisted that he (should) walk there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他坚持要步行去那里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He persisted that he did the work alone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他坚持他一个人做那件事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She persisted that she was strong enough to go back to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她反复地说她身体已经好了, 可以去上班了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They persisted in going there in spite of the bad weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管天气很坏, 他们还是坚持去那里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She persisted in singing although I asked her not to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管我叫她别唱歌, 她还是坚持要唱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of them persist in setting strict demands on themselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们大多数人坚持严格要求自己。</font><br>\n

pinch	<h3>pinch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>盗窃, 偷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thief pinched her purse and ran away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小偷偷了她的皮夹子跑了。</font><br>逮捕, 拘留<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police pinched him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察逮捕了他。</font><br>夹痛, 扎痛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These shoes pinch my feet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这双鞋把我的脚夹痛了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>捏, 掐, 夹, 拧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These shoes must be too small because they pinch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因为这双鞋夹脚, 所以他们一定是太小了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child was crying because somebody had pinched her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子哭了, 因为有人掐她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mother pinched her baby black and blue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位母亲将她的孩子掐得青一块紫一块的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>捏, 掐, 夹, 拧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave him a pinch to wake him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拧了他一下以弄醒他。</font><br>一撮, 微量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put a pinch of salt on his food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在自己的食物上撒了一撮盐。</font><br>困苦, 穷苦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's six months since he lost his job, so he's beginning to feel the pinch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他失业已有六个月了, 所以开始感到相当困难。</font><br>\n

pond	<h3>pond</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>池塘<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most farms have a pond from which cattle can drink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大部分农场有池塘供牛喝水。</font><br>\n
ponder	<h3>ponder</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>考虑; 深思熟虑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She pondered his marriage proposal for weeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个星期以来她认真地考虑着他的求婚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The young couple are pondering moving their house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这对年轻夫妇正在考虑把自己的家搬走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We pondered whether to tell him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们考虑是否要告诉他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I asked advice, he pondered and then told me not to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我向他请示, 他考虑了一下, 然后叫我不要去。</font><br>\n
pony	<h3>pony</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>矮种马, 小型马<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father gave him a pony as a Christmas present.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他父亲给了他一匹小马驹作为圣诞礼物。</font><br>\n

porter	<h3>porter</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>搬运工人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tipped the porter 50p.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我给了搬运工人50便士小费。</font><br>门童<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hotel porter will help you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅馆的门童可以帮你的忙。</font><br>\n
portfolio	<h3>portfolio</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>公事包, 文件夹<br>投资组合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My stockbroker manages my portfolio for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的证券经纪人替我管理投资组合。</font><br>大臣或部长的职位或职责<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He resigned his portfolio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他辞去了大臣职务。</font><br>\n
portion	<h3>portion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一部分, 一份<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three thousand dollars is no more than a portion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 3000美元只不过是一部分。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You are paid your portion not later than a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不会晚于一周你就可以得到你那一部分报酬。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ordered a portion of fried eggs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她点了一份煎蛋。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…分成份额, 分配<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They portioned the food out to the poor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将食物分发给穷人。</font><br>\n
portray	<h3>portray</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>画像; 描述<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book portrayed his personal experience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书描绘了他的个人经历。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He portrayed himself as a champion for democracy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把自己描绘成民主斗士。</font><br>扮演<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He portrayed Napoleon in the play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在戏里扮演拿破仑。</font><br>\n
possess	<h3>possess</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>具有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country possesses rich mineral deposits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家拥有丰富的矿藏。</font><br>占据<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He possessed his soul in patience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他耐心等待。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is possessed with rage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在盛怒之中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The desire to be rich possessed him to act so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发财的欲望使他做出如此之事来。</font><br>\n
possession	<h3>possession</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>占有, 持有, 拥有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Egyptians strove with the Romans for the possession of the Nile Valley.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃及人为占有尼罗河谷而与罗马人斗争。</font><br>个人财产, 私人财物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She forsook her worldly possessions to devote herself to the church.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抛弃世上的财物而献身教会。</font><br>领地, 属地, 殖民地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp India was Britain's former overseas possession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 印度是英国过去的海外领地。</font><br>\n
post	<h3>post</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>柱, 杆, 桩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The post is stalled fast in the ground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那根柱子牢牢地竖在地上。</font><br>终点标志<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horses galloped towards the post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马飞快地冲向终点。</font><br>邮政<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was no end to the letters pouring into the post office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有大量的信投进了邮局。</font><br>邮件<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A letter has come for you in the second post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天的第二批邮件中有一封你的信。</font><br>邮局, 邮筒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've just taken her birthday card down to the post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我刚把她的生日贺卡拿去邮局寄。</font><br>职位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ask him whether he would accept the post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 问问他是否愿意就任该职。</font><br>岗位, 哨位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't think I should be suitable for the post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为这个岗位对我不合适。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>张贴; 贴在…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Post this notice on the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把这个通知贴在墙上。</font><br>宣布; 公告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have posted the ship (as) missing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已宣布那艘船失踪。</font><br>邮寄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He posted the letter this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他今天上午把信寄出去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I posted him a letter yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天我给他邮去一封信。</font><br>设岗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This place was not very safe, so they wanted to post guard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地方不太安全, 因此他们想设岗于此。</font><br>委派<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We posted a guard to keep watch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们派了一名卫兵站岗。</font><br>\n

practise	<h3>practise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>练习; 实习<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You don't practise enough.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你练得不够。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He practises tennis every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每天练习打网球。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girls are practising singing the new song in the next room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 姑娘们正在隔壁练习唱新歌。</font><br>积极从事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man is just beginning to practise law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此人刚刚开始操律师业。</font><br>\n
practitioner	<h3>practitioner</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>习艺者, 实习者<br>从业者(尤指医师)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was a medical practitioner before she entered politics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从政前她是个开业医生。</font><br>\n
pray	<h3>pray</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>祈祷, 祷告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They knelt down and prayed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们跪下祈祷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We pray God's forgiveness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们祈求上帝的宽恕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He prayed to be forgiven.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他祈求宽恕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We prayed that she would recover.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们为她尽快康复而祈祷。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>〈文或旧〉请求, 恳求<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take great care, I pray you!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要倍加小心, 我求你了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We pray you to set the child free.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们恳求你放了这个孩子。</font><br>\n
prayer	<h3>prayer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>祈祷, 祈祷文<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He says his prayers every night before he goes to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每晚睡觉前都做晚祷。</font><br>祈祷(习惯)<br>\n
preach	<h3>preach</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>讲道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He felt very tired, for he preached for a long time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于讲道太久, 他感觉非常疲劳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man was preaching the Gospel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此人在传布福音。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Christ preached that we should love each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 基督在布道中说人们应该互爱。</font><br>劝诫; 说教<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is not the author's business to preach, but to give a real, historical picture of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作者的责任不在于说教, 而在于展现一幅真实的具有历史意义的生活画面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't preach me that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要以那件事说教我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man preached temperance to young people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位老人劝年轻人戒酒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She preached economy as the best means of solving the crisis.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她倡导说节约是解决危机的最佳方法。</font><br>\n
precaution	<h3>precaution</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>预防措施<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I took the precaution of locking money in the safe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把所有的钱都锁在保险箱里以防万一。</font><br>\n
precede	<h3>precede</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>在…之前, 先于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The days that preceded were filled with activity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 前几天排满了活动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A band preceded the soldiers in the parade.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在阅兵行列中一支乐队走在士兵的前面。</font><br>\n
precedent	<h3>precedent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>范例, 判例<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He copied after bad precedents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他仿效恶例。</font><br>\n
precious	<h3>precious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>宝贵的, 珍贵的, 贵重的, 珍爱的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has sent me most precious gifts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他送给我极其珍贵的礼物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Each life is precious.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生命都是宝贵的。</font><br>矫揉造作的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was a precious, old-fashioned lady in her 90's.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一个90多岁的、过分讲究的旧式老太太。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>〈口〉很, 非常<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Precious few people can afford prices like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有什么人出得起那个价钱。</font><br>\n
precise	<h3>precise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>精确的, 准确的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A scientist must be precise in making tests.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 科学家做试验必须精确。</font><br>恰好的; 正是的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the precise moment that I put my foot on the step, the bus started.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恰好就在我登上公共汽车台阶的时候, 车开动了。</font><br>周密的, 细密的, 精细的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A lawyer needs a precise mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 律师需要有周密的头脑。</font><br>\n
precision	<h3>precision</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>精确度, 准确(性)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Precision instruments are used to help pilots in guiding their aircraft.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 精密仪器用来帮助飞行员操作飞机。</font><br>\n
predecessor	<h3>predecessor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>前任, 前辈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As a scholar he is not in the same street with his predecessors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作为学者, 他远不如其前辈。</font><br>(被取代的)原有事物, 前身<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will new plan be any more acceptable than its predecessors?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新计划比原先的计划更能令人满意吗?</font><br>\n
predictable	<h3>predictable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>可预言[预报]的<br>不出所料的, 可以想见的; 平庸的; 墨守陈规的; 毫无想像力的<br>\n
prediction	<h3>prediction</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>预言; 预言的事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This great prediction is coming true.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一伟大的预言正在成为现实。</font><br>\n
preferable	<h3>preferable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>更好的, 更适合的, 更可取的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Health without riches is preferable to riches without health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有健康而无财富比有财富而无健康更好。</font><br>\n
preference	<h3>preference</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>较喜欢的东西, 偏爱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My preference is that we (should) challenge the other groups to a friendly competition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢向别的组挑战, 来一个友谊竞赛。</font><br>优待, 优惠, 优先权<br>\n
prejudice	<h3>prejudice</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>成见, 偏见, 歧视<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They accused him of having a prejudice against his women employees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们指责他歧视女雇员。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使有偏见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His voice and manner prejudice his audience against him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的声音和举止都使听众反感。</font><br>不利于, 损害<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your bad spelling may prejudice your chances of getting this job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你糟糕的拼写会妨碍你获得这个工作的机会。</font><br>\n
preliminary	<h3>preliminary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>初步的, 预备的, 开端的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are taking preliminary steps in preparation for a possible war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在为应付一场可能的战争做初步的准备。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>准备工作, 初步行动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are a lot of preliminaries to be gone through before you can visit certain foreigners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在访问某些外国人之前要做好许多准备工作。</font><br>\n
premature	<h3>premature</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>过早的, 提前的, 未到期的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A fire caused the premature closing of the exhibition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火灾迫使展览会提前结束。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is yet premature to predict the possible outcome of the dialogue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 预言这次对话可能有什么结果为时尚早。</font><br>早产的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The premature baby is doing well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个早产的婴儿很健康。</font><br>\n
premiere	<h3>premiere</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>v.</i></font><br>初次公演,初演主角<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>初次的演出<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>突出的,杰出的<br>\n
premise	<h3>premise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>前提<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These are the major and minor premises on which the conclusion is based.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是这个结论所依据的前提。</font><br>(逻辑学中的)大[小]前提<br>\n
prescribe	<h3>prescribe</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>开药方; 指示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor prepared to prescribe a receipt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生准备开个药方。</font><br>规定, 指定遵守<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The law prescribes how to punish this crime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法律对如何处罚这种犯罪做出规定。</font><br>\n
prescription	<h3>prescription</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>药, 治疗方法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dispenser quickly filled the prescription for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 药剂师立刻照处方为我配了药。</font><br>处方, 药方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The physician made a prescription against sea-sickness for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生给他开了个治晕船的药方。</font><br>开处方, 开药<br>\n
presentation	<h3>presentation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>提供, 显示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On presentation of the relevant identity documents you may collect your property.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你只要出示有关的身份证件就可以领取你的财产。</font><br>外观<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The presentation of food can be as important as the taste.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 食物的外观和味道同样重要。</font><br>授予(物), 赠送(仪式)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Queen will make the presentation herself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 女王将亲手赠送礼品。</font><br>报告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His presentation was clear and incisive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的报告清晰而犀利。</font><br>表演<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Last week we went to the presentation of a new play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上星期我们去观看了一场新剧的演出。</font><br>\n

prestigious	<h3>prestigious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>受尊敬的, 有声望的, 有威信的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her first novel won a prestigious literary prize.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的第一部小说就获得了一个颇具声望的文学奖。</font><br>\n
presume	<h3>presume</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>以为; 假定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You had better presume no such thing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你最好不要这样设想。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>冒昧地做某事; 错用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I presume to suggest that you should take legal advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我冒昧地建议:你应该找律师咨询。</font><br>自作主张, 放肆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't presume too far!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要太放肆！</font><br>\n

pretend	<h3>pretend</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>假装, 伪装<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp So you don't need to pretend, do you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所以你不必装假了, 对吧?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pretended illness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他假装病了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pretended to fall over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他假装跌倒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They pretended that they were tourists.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们假装是旅行者。</font><br>\n
prevail	<h3>prevail</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>说服, 劝说; 诱使<br>盛行, 流行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This fashion still prevails.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种式样仍在流行。</font><br>获胜; 占优势<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Justice has prevailed; the guilty man has been punished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正义得到伸张, 罪犯受到惩罚。</font><br>\n
preview	<h3>preview</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>预展, 试映, 预演<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They attended a sneak preview of the winter fashion collection.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们参观了一次对内的冬季时装预展。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>预映, 预演, 预习<br>\n
prey	<h3>prey</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>被捕食的动物, 猎物, 牺牲品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lion was hunting for its prey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狮子在寻找猎物。</font><br>捕食(习性), 掠食<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A tiger is a beast of prey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老虎是食肉的野兽。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>捕食, 掠食<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stronger animals prey on weaker ones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 弱肉强食。</font><br>折磨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This problem has been preying on my mind all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个问题让我伤了整整一天脑筋。</font><br>(人)靠欺诈为生<br>\n
primarily	<h3>primarily</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>主要地, 首要地; 本来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am primarily interested in history.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我主要对历史感兴趣。</font><br>首先<br>\n
primitive	<h3>primitive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>原始的, 早期的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Primitive man made himself primitive tools from stones and bones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 原始人用石块和骨头做原始的工具。</font><br>简单的; 粗糙的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a primitive boat out of some pieces of wood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用几块木头做了艘简易的小船。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>文艺复兴前的画家或雕刻家; 早期的艺术家<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was an Italian primitive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一位意大利早期的艺术家。</font><br>原始人, 原始事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The anthropology of the future will not be concerned above all else with primitives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 未来的人类学不会以原始人为主要的研究对象。</font><br>\n
printer	<h3>printer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>印刷业从业人员, 印刷工人<br>印刷机, 印照片机<br>打印机<br>\n
privacy	<h3>privacy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>隐居, (不受干扰的)独处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must have disturbed your privacy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他必定打扰了你的清静。</font><br>私事, 隐私<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I demand an explanation for your rude intrusion upon my privacy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要求你对于无礼地侵扰我的私人生活的行为做出解释。</font><br>\n
privilege	<h3>privilege</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>特权, 特别待遇<br>(因财富和社会地位而仅有部分人享有的)权益<br>特殊荣幸<br>\n
privileged	<h3>privileged</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>保密的, 秘密的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Discussions between a lawyer and client are privileged communications.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 律师与当事人之间的谈话属于保密信息。</font><br>享有特权的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only the privileged few could afford to send their children to private schools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有少数享有特权的人才能负担得起送孩子去私立学校就读。</font><br>\n
pro	<h3>pro</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>赞成的意见, 赞成的理由<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should hear all the pros and cons of the matter before we make a decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在对这事做出决定之前, 应该先听取正反两方面的意见。</font><br>\n
probe	<h3>probe</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>探索, 调查<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police probe into organized crime led to several arrests.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方对有组织犯罪的调查使数人受到拘捕。</font><br>探针, 探测器<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A doctor used a probe to remove metal fragments from a wound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生用探针将伤口中的金属碎片取出。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>探索; 用探针(或探测器等)探查, 探测<br>\n
proceeding	<h3>proceeding</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>进程, 过程, 议程<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The proceedings were interrupted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议的进程被打断了。</font><br>诉讼, 诉讼程序<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She started proceedings against her husband for divorce.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她提出与她丈夫离婚的诉讼。</font><br>会议记录; 公报<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He carefully read the proceedings from last meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他认真阅读了上次会议的记录。</font><br>\n
procession	<h3>procession</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>队伍, 行列<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A funeral procession filled the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 送葬队伍挤满了街道。</font><br>列队行进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The students entered the school in procession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学生们排队进入学校。</font><br>\n
processor	<h3>processor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>加工、处理事物的人(或设备、产业)<br>(计算机的)中央处理器<br>\n
proclaim	<h3>proclaim</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>正式宣布<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has proclaimed a new law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府已公布了一项新法令。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ringing bells proclaimed the birth of the prince.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 响亮的钟声宣布王子的诞生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The constitution proclaims that public property shall be inviolate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 宪法宣告公共财产不可侵犯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government proclaimed both of them national heroes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府宣布他们两人为民族英雄。</font><br>显示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His accent proclaimed that he was a southerner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的口音表明他是南方人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His manners proclaimed him a gentleman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的风度显示出他是绅士。</font><br>\n
productive	<h3>productive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>多产的, 富饶的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lived on the produc -tive land.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们生活在富饶的土地上。</font><br>富有成效的; 有益的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had a productive meeting that solved some problems.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们开了一个富有成效的会议, 解决了一些问题。</font><br>\n
productivity	<h3>productivity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>生产率, 生产力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Computers have greatly increased productivity in business offices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计算机大大提高了商务办公室的工作效率。</font><br>\n
profitable	<h3>profitable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>有利可图的; 有益的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That business became profitable last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那项生意去年变得很赚钱。</font><br>\n
profound	<h3>profound</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>深度的; 深切的; 深远的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I give you my profound thanks for saving my life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对您的救命之恩深表谢意。</font><br>知识渊博的, 见解深刻的, 深奥的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a profound knowledge of mathematics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他数学知识渊博。</font><br>\n
progressive	<h3>progressive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不断前进的, 有进展的, 逐渐上升的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a progressive course in English study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是英语学习的渐进课程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a progressive disease and he would suffer more and more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病情逐渐加剧, 他将忍受越来越大的痛苦。</font><br>进步的, 先进的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a progressive idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一种进步的思想。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a progressive firm that uses the most modern systems.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一家使用非常现代化系统的先进企业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many young politicians are progressive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多年轻的政治家是进步的。</font><br>\n

quarrel	<h3>quarrel</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>争吵, 不和, 口角<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The quarrel resulted in his mother leaving the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 争吵导致了他母亲离家出走。</font><br>抱怨…的原因[理由]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That is part of my quarrel against them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是我与他们争吵的部分原因。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>争吵, 争辩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now, boys, don't quarrel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们, 不要吵了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know you've been quarrelling a good deal lately.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道你们近来时常吵嘴。</font><br>不同意; 挑剔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't quarrel with the decision of the court; it's very fair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能反对法院的判决, 它判得很公正。</font><br>\n

rack	<h3>rack</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>行李架<br>刑架, 拷问台<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使痛苦, 使焦虑; 绞尽脑汁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pain racked him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 痛苦折磨着他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Conscience racks me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我受良心责备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cough seemed to rack his body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他咳得全身震动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The storm racked the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风暴在全城肆虐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He racked no rents to maintain the expenses of his establishment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不向租户索取过高的租金来维持公司的开支。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was racked by remorse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他悔恨交加。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was racked by doubts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她满腹疑虑, 痛苦极了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have been racked by bitter quarrels.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 激烈的争吵使他们不得安生。</font><br>\n

removal	<h3>removal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>移走, 脱掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the removal of the soup, fish was served.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤撤去后, 鱼就上来了。</font><br>\n
renaissance	<h3>renaissance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>文艺复兴, 文艺复兴时期<br>\n
render	<h3>render</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>报答; 归还; 给予<br>呈递; 提供; 开出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She needed him to hear her out and render advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她需要他把话听完并提出建议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will have to render an account of your expenditure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的开支必须报账。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are going to render them economic assistance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们打算向他们提供经济援助。</font><br>演出; 扮演; 演奏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The piano concerto was wonderfully rendered.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这首钢琴协奏曲演奏得很好。</font><br>翻译<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sentence cannot be literally rendered.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个句子不能直译。</font><br>使; 致使<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You have rendered a great service to the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为国家做了一件大事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shock of the discovery rendered him speechless.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一发现使他吃惊得一句话也说不出来。</font><br>\n
renewal	<h3>renewal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>重建; 更新<br>重生<br>\n
