revive	<h3>revive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>恢复, 苏醒, 复活<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He revived after a rest and some food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过休息并吃了一点食物之后, 他恢复了体力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The roses revived after the rain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨后玫瑰花又复活了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fresh air soon revived him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新鲜空气很快使他苏醒过来。</font><br>使再生效, 回忆起, 使再流行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old popular songs have revived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老的流行歌曲再度流行起来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I revived a scene in my mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回忆起一个景象。</font><br>\n
revolt	<h3>revolt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)厌恶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The violence in the movie revolted me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电影里的暴力行为使我反感。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>反叛; 背叛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His whole nature revolted against deceit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他生来就对欺骗行为反感。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tribesmen will revolt if you ask them to pay taxes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你若要求部落里的人们交税, 他们会反叛的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>造反, 起义<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The governor convened his troops to put down the revolt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总督召集他的部队去镇压叛乱。</font><br>\n
rhetoric	<h3>rhetoric</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>雄辩言辞, 虚夸的言辞<br>修辞学<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you know something about rhetoric?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你懂点修辞学吗?</font><br>\n
rib	<h3>rib</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>肋骨, 排骨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He suffered three cracked ribs in the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在一次事故中折断了三根肋骨。</font><br>肋骨状的东西; 骨架<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ribs of the umbrella are strong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨伞的骨架非常结实。</font><br>\n
ribbon	<h3>ribbon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>带, 缎带, 丝带<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her hair was tied up with a ribbon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用一条丝带系着头发。</font><br>(打印机的)色带<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Typewriter ribbons may be all black or black and red.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打字机的色带可以是全黑的或黑红色的。</font><br>\n
ridge	<h3>ridge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>脊, 山脊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We walked along the mountain ridge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们顺着山脊行走。</font><br>脊状突起<br>\n
ridiculous	<h3>ridiculous</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>可笑的, 荒谬的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard in my life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是我有生以来听到的最为荒唐可笑的事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is ridiculous to dispute about such things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 争论这样的事情是可笑的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's ridiculous that we should have to queue, when we have already got our tickets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已经拿到了票, 居然还要排队, 未免可笑。</font><br>\n
riding	<h3>riding</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>骑马<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Should the weather be rough, we won't be able to go riding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 万一是狂风暴雨的天气, 我们就不能去骑马。</font><br>\n
rifle	<h3>rifle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>步枪<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have a few rifles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们有几支步枪。</font><br>\n
rig	<h3>rig</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>船桅(或船帆等)的装置<br>成套器械<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>给(船、桅杆)装配帆及索具<br>用临时替代材料迅速搭起<br>(用不正当手段)操纵, 垄断<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They complained that the election had been rigged.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们投诉这次选举被人操纵。</font><br>\n
right	<h3>right</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>正当的, 适当的, 合法的, 符合要求的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll try to do whatever is right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只要是正当的事, 我都尽力去做。</font><br>对的, 正确的, 准确的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave the right answer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他做出了正确的回答。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Actually, that's not quite right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 实际上, 那不完全对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was right that I should be present.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我自然应当到场。</font><br>右边的, 右方的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take a right turn at the crossroads.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在十字路口右转弯。</font><br>切合实际的, 最适宜的, 最恰当的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's the sort of woman who always says the right things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一个说话总能恰到好处的女人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their ages were just right for a match.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他俩的年龄结婚匹配正相宜。</font><br>良好的, 正常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Things are right now again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事情又恢复正常了。</font><br>真实的, 完全的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That man's a right idiot!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个男子完全是个白痴。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>准确地; 直接地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go right home at once, don't stop off anywhere on the way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 直接回家去, 别在路上的什么地方呆下来。</font><br>彻底地; 完全地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm right behind you there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我完全支持你。</font><br>向右, 往右<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Turn right at the end of the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这条街的尽头向右拐。</font><br>正确地; 令人满意地; 恰当地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have I guessed right or wrong?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我猜得对不对?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing seems to be going right for me at the moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在好像事事不顺心。</font><br>立即, 马上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll go right after lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 午饭后我马上去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>正确; 正当; 公正; 正义<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You're old enough to know the difference between right and wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你已经长大了, 能够分辨是非了。</font><br>权利<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We fought for the right of access to government information.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们争取查看政府资料的权利。</font><br>右边, 右面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tony was sitting on my right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 托尼坐在我的右边。</font><br>右手, 右手拳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got me with a right to the jaw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用右手朝我下巴打了一拳。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使回复到适当的[正确的, 直立的]位置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The inventory situation was righting itself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 库存局面正在恢复正常。</font><br>纠正, 改正<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mistake is being righted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 错误正在得到纠正。</font><br>\n

roar	<h3>roar</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>咆哮, 怒吼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who dares to answer back when he roars like a lion?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他像狮子般地咆哮时, 谁敢和他顶嘴?</font><br>大笑, 狂笑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His jokes made us all roar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的玩笑让我们大家哄笑不止。</font><br>大哭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He began to roar when I took the chocolate away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当我把巧克力拿走时, 他大哭起来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>大声喊出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He roared that was a violation of the rules.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他大声说, 那是违反规则的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was too excited and roared himself hoarse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他过于激动, 嗓子都喊哑了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>吼叫声; 咆哮声; 呼啸声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was frightened by the roars of a lion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她被狮子的吼叫声吓呆了。</font><br>\n
roast	<h3>roast</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>烤; 烘; 焙<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put the meat into the oven to roast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把肉放到炉子里去烤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun was roasting us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳火辣辣地炙晒着我们。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>嘲讽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They roasted his new book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们狠狠地挖苦他的新书。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>烤肉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's have a nice roast for Sunday dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们星期天晚餐好好吃一顿烤肉。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>烤好的, 烤制的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's a piece of roast beef.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这儿有一块烤牛肉。</font><br>\n

rod	<h3>rod</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>竿, 杆, 棒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pass me a bamboo rod.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 递给我一根竹竿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wheels of the toy car were fixed on metal rods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玩具车的轮子固定在金属棒上。</font><br>\n
roller	<h3>roller</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>滚压机; 滚杠, 滚柱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They pushed the boat down to the water on rollers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们利用滚杠把小船推下水。</font><br>定型卷夹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She put her hair in rollers to make it curl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用卷发夹子把头发弄鬈曲。</font><br>巨浪<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The great Atlantic rollers surged in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大西洋的巨浪翻滚到岸边。</font><br>\n
romance	<h3>romance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>浪漫史, 风流韵事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane's and Paul's life together is full of romance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简和保罗的共同生活充满了浪漫色彩。</font><br>爱情小说, 浪漫故事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wrote a romance about an artist's life in Tokyo.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她写了一个关于一位艺术家在东京生活的浪漫故事。</font><br>\n
rope	<h3>rope</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>粗绳, 绳索, 缆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They tied the ship to the quay with ropes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用绳子把船拴在码头上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you go to a new school it takes a while to learn the ropes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当你上一所新的学校时, 你需要花一段时间熟悉内情。</font><br>一串<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>(用绳子)捆, 绑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He roped his horse to a nearby tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把马拴在附近的一棵树上。</font><br>\n
rot	<h3>rot</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>腐烂, 腐朽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rot in the tree trunk caused the tree to fall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 树干的腐烂导致树倒了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)腐烂, (使)腐朽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dead plants rot and become part of the soil again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 枯死的植物腐烂, 又成为土壤的一部分。</font><br>\n
rotate	<h3>rotate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使某物)旋转[转动]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The earth rotates around the sun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地球绕着太阳转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor asked the patient to rotate his eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生叫病人转动一下眼球。</font><br>(使某人或某物)轮流[按顺序循环]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The post of chairman rotates among members of the committee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主席一职由委员会的成员轮流担任。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can rotate the wheel with your hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以用手转动轮子。</font><br>\n
rotten	<h3>rotten</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>腐烂的; 腐朽的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smell of the rotten meat was enough!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这腐臭的肉闻一下就够人受的了！</font><br>道德败坏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man's morals are rotten to the core.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个人道德败坏至极。</font><br>极坏的; 极讨厌的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's a rotten cook.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她做的饭很差劲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book was pretty rotten.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书糟透了。</font><br>\n

rouge	<h3>rouge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>胭脂, 口红<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Women put rouge on their cheeks to make their faces pretty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 女人往面颊上涂胭脂, 使脸更漂亮。</font><br>\n
round	<h3>round</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>圆形的, 球形的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child had a round face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子脸蛋圆润。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The area was perfectly round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那区域完全是圆形的。</font><br>滚圆的, 丰满的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was a short and round man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个矮胖的男人。</font><br>用整数表示的, 取整数的, 整整的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Give me a round dozen and I'll pay in cash.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我一整打, 我将付现金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What he said is a round lie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他所说的是十足的谎话。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>绕圈子; 围绕地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horse is running round the field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马在场上兜着圈子跑。</font><br>在周围; 在附近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A crowd soon gathered round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一群人很快围了上来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He visited all the people round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他访问了附近所有的人。</font><br>到各处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let me show you round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我领你到处转转。</font><br>去某地点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He invited us round for drinks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他请我们到家里喝几杯。</font><br>到处, 各处, 逐一地, 挨个地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I haven't got enough candies to go round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有足够的糖果可让每人都分到。</font><br>朝反方向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Turn the picture round to face the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把画转过去面对墙。</font><br>大约, 大概<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was the face of a man round fifty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是一个五十岁光景的男人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…四周, 围绕于…; 向[在]…各处, 遍及; 在…附近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They swarmed close round her to hear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们挤在她的周围听着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lives in a village round the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他住在这个小镇附近的一个村庄里。</font><br>(表示时间)从…的开始到结束; 在…整个期间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shops are always crowded with people all round the year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商店一年到头总是挤满了人。</font><br>(表示方向)环绕, 围绕; 往[在]…的另一边, 绕过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a mile by water, four miles round the shore.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由水路去只有一英里, 沿岸绕行要四英里。</font><br>(表示状态)团结在…周围, 跟随着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The reformer soon gathered a band of followers round him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 改革者很快就获得一群追随者支持他。</font><br>(表示论及)关于…的解决办法[途径]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are several solutions round this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关于这一点有几个解决办法。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>圆(片)形食物; 圆; 圆形物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cut the pastry into small rounds, one for each pie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把油酥面团切成小圆片, 每个馅饼用一片。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These are ６ whole rounds of bread.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些是六整份的面包。</font><br>一回合, 一局, 一场<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Each round of the boxing match lasts three minutes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拳击比赛每回合时间是三分钟。</font><br>一连串, 一系列, 一套, 一组; 一阵<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A round of parties ushered in the New Year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一系列的晚会迎来了新年。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His speech won round after round of enthusiastic applause.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的演讲博得了一阵又一阵的热烈掌声。</font><br>巡视(路线); 巡回(路线)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The night watchman makes the rounds of the building every hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 巡夜人员每小时都巡视这建筑物。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)成圆形<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children's eyes rounded with excitement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小孩子们兴奋得瞪圆了眼睛。</font><br>绕行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bear rounded and faced the hunters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 熊转过身, 面对着猎人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rounded a corner and walked into a narrow street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拐过弯走进一条狭窄的街道。</font><br>\n
royalty	<h3>royalty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>王族(成员)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flag is only raised when royalty is present.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有在王室成员在场的时候才升起这面旗帜。</font><br>(著作的)版税<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The writer gets a ten percent royalty on each copy of his book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作者从每本卖出的书中可得到百分之十的版税。</font><br>\n
rub	<h3>rub</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>擦; 搓; 揉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go and rub your hands dry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 去把你的双手擦干。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>接触; 摩擦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My shoe rubbed my heel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的一只鞋子硌脚跟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The journal rubs against the bearing surface.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轴颈在轴承面上摩擦。</font><br>\n
rubber	<h3>rubber</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(合成)橡胶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rubber will not let water through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水浸不透橡胶。</font><br>橡皮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Leather, rubber and wire are flexible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 皮革、橡皮和电线都是易弯曲的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pencil marks can be erased with a rubber.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 铅笔的痕迹可被橡皮擦掉。</font><br>黑板擦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher is cleaning the blackboard with a board rubber.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师正在用黑板擦擦黑板。</font><br>橡胶套鞋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We wear rubbers on our feet when it rains.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下雨时我们穿橡胶套鞋。</font><br>\n
rubbish	<h3>rubbish</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>垃圾, 废弃物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a pile of rubbish in the corner of the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在街道的拐角处有一堆垃圾。</font><br>无意义的东西; 废话, 胡说八道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This book is all rubbish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书全是胡言乱语。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>〈英澳·非正〉把…说得一钱不值; 贬损…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book was rubbished by them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书被他们贬得一无是处。</font><br>\n
rude	<h3>rude</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>粗鲁的; 不礼貌的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't make rude remarks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要说粗话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is rude to point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 指指点点是不礼貌的。</font><br>近乎下流的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His brother is being rude.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的哥哥变得粗暴无礼起来了。</font><br>狂暴的; 惊人的; 突然的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship got a rude shock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船受到猛烈的震荡。</font><br>简陋的, 粗制的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They only have rude tools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们只有些简陋的工具。</font><br>\n
rue	<h3>rue</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>对…感到后悔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rued the day that he rode the motorcycle because he fell off and broke his leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他懊悔那天开摩托车时摔断了腿。</font><br>\n

salute	<h3>salute</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>欢迎; 致敬<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The guard saluted me smartly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 卫兵向我行了个漂亮的军礼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The officers saluted as the soldiers marched past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当士兵以分列式通过时, 军官举手敬礼。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>赞扬; 赞颂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I salute my opponent's courage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我赞扬对手的勇气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The people saluted him for his tireless efforts for peace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们对他为和平所做的不懈努力表示敬意。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>致敬, 欢迎, 敬礼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Queen's birthday was honoured by a 21-gun salute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鸣二十一响礼炮庆祝女王的生日。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He extended a salute to his father.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他向他的父亲致敬。</font><br>\n
salvage	<h3>salvage</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>救援费<br>海上营救<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Salvage was hampered.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海上营救受到了阻碍。</font><br>经加工后重新利用的废物, 废料回收<br>抢救出的财产<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The salvage was piled upon the pier.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抢救出的财产被堆放在码头上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>(从火灾、海难等中)抢救(某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All attempts to salvage the wrecked ship failed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抢救失事船只的一切努力都失败了。</font><br>回收利用(某物)<br>\n
salvation	<h3>salvation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(对人的灵魂的)拯救<br>避免损失、躲避灾难等的途径或方法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Salvation lay in political reform.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 解救办法在于政治改革。</font><br>\n
sanctuary	<h3>sanctuary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>圣所, 圣地<br>圣堂<br>庇护所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fleeing rebels found a sanctuary in the nearby church.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正在逃窜的反叛分子在附近的教堂里避难。</font><br>庇护, 庇护权<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was glad to climb into the sanctuary of my bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很乐意爬上床躲起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most countries refuse to give sanctuary to people who hijack aeroplanes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数国家拒绝对劫机者提供庇护。</font><br>避难所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a sanctuary of political refugees behind the hospital.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医院后面有一个政治难民的避难所 。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The outlaw was granted sanctuary in the church.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这名犯法者获准在教堂里避难。</font><br>禁猎区, 鸟兽类保护区<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This island is maintained as a sanctuary for endangered species.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个岛继续作为濒危物种的保护区。</font><br>\n

scent	<h3>scent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>气味, 香味<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scent of lemons filled the grove.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 柠檬香味充满了小树林。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The winds came down with scents of the grass and wild flowers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 微风送来阵阵青草和野花的香气。</font><br>香水<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl always uses too much scent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这姑娘总是用过多的香水。</font><br>(动物的)臭迹, 遗臭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hounds followed the stag's scent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那群猎犬循臭味追寻牡鹿。</font><br>线索<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police are now on the scent of the culprit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方正在追踪罪犯。</font><br>(尤指狗的)嗅觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A dog has keen scent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狗具有灵敏的嗅觉。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>(动物等)嗅出…的气味, 嗅出…的存在<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dogs had scented a fox.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些狗嗅出附近有狐狸。</font><br>察觉到(坏事等的)存在; 觉得有, 怀疑有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He scented danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他觉察到有危险。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I scented that all was not well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得一切都不正常。</font><br>使充满香味; 洒香水于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The air was scented with spring flowers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 空气中充满了春天花朵的芳香。</font><br>\n

scramble	<h3>scramble</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>快速爬行, 匍匐前进; 攀登<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He scrambled over the rocks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他爬上了岩石。</font><br>争夺, 争抢<br>(军事飞机)紧急起飞<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>(用黄油)炒蛋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is scrambling eggs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正在炒蛋。</font><br>扰频或倒频使(电话通话等)只可由有特殊接收器的人收听<br>混杂; 把…搅乱<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>爬行, 攀登<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke his leg in his scramble down the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他爬墙摔断了腿。</font><br>争夺, 抢夺<br>\n
scrap	<h3>scrap</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>小片, 碎片, 碎屑; 少许<br>废料<br>吵架; 口角<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>废弃, 丢弃<br>把…当作废料处理<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>吵架; 打架<br>\n
scrape	<h3>scrape</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>刮, 擦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was so windy that the branches were scraping against the window panes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风很大, 树枝在玻璃窗上拂来拂去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He scraped his boots clean before coming into the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进屋前他先把靴子擦干净。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>擦伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car scraped its side against the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车的车身在墙上擦坏了。</font><br>设法得到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We managed to scrape an audience of fifty people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们设法争取到了五十名观众。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>刮, 擦, 刮擦声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pushed back his chair with a loud scrape.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “嘎”的一声, 他把椅子推回了原位。</font><br>擦痕, 擦伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you get a few scrapes on your knee?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你膝盖上的几处擦伤是怎么弄的?</font><br>困境, 麻烦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gets into these silly scrapes because she doesn't think before she acts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在行动之前总不思考, 所以才会陷入这种荒唐的窘境。</font><br>\n
scratch	<h3>scratch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>抓, 搔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog is always scratching.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那只狗老是搔痒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a curious habit of scratching his ear while he speaks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有一种奇怪的习惯, 一讲话就搔耳朵。</font><br>刮伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The brambles scratched my legs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 荆棘刺伤了我的双腿。</font><br>勾掉, 删掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope you are not going to scratch me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望你不会把我的名字从比赛中划去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>抓; 搔痒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His dog just gives a scratch at the door when it wants to come in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的狗想进来时就用爪子抓门。</font><br>抓痕, 抓伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her face was covered with scratches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她脸上有很多划痕。</font><br>刮擦声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard the scratches on the old records.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听到旧唱片的沙沙声。</font><br>\n
screw	<h3>screw</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>螺丝钉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The handle of this door is kept by two screws.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这扇门的把手用两枚螺丝钉固定。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用螺丝拧紧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Squeaking floorboards should be screwed down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 踏上去咯咯作响的地板应用螺钉钉住。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The table legs are screwed to the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌子腿用螺钉固定在地板上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>旋, 扭; 拧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two pieces screw together easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两个部件很容易拧紧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's screw the two pipes together end to end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们把这两根管子接起来拧紧。</font><br>\n
scrub	<h3>scrub</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>用力擦洗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She scrubbed the stain on the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把地板上的污迹擦掉了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>对…不予考虑; 取消<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>擦洗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door needs a scrub.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门需要刷一下。</font><br>\n
scrutiny	<h3>scrutiny</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>细看, 细查; 监视<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drew the conclusion after scrutinies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过详尽的调查他才得出这个结论。</font><br>\n

secondary	<h3>secondary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>次要的, 次等的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a question of secondary importance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个次要的问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All other considerations are secondary to his safety.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在首先要考虑的是他的安全, 其他事均是次要的。</font><br>中级的, 第二的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Secondary school means junior school and high school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 中学是指初中和高中。</font><br>\n

seldom	<h3>seldom</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>很少, 罕见, 难得<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On Sundays, he seldom stays in the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 星期天他很少待在房子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Seldom have I heard such beautiful singing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很少听到过如此美妙的歌声。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is seldom that it rains in such a time in winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在冬天这个时候很少下雨。</font><br>\n

shave	<h3>shave</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(用剃刀)刮(胡须等); 为(某人)剃毛发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shave every morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我每天早上刮脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He shaved his head bald.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把头发剃光了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>刨(木头等); 削; 刮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shaved a few millimetres from the bottom of the door to make it close properly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把这门的底部薄薄地刨去几毫米使它能关严。</font><br>〈口〉掠过, 擦过(某人或某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car just shaved the wall while it was cornering.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车在拐弯时恰好擦过墙边。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>剃, 刮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A sharp razor gives a close shave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剃刀锋利刮得就干净。</font><br>\n
sheep	<h3>sheep</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>羊, 绵羊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look, there are three sheep eating grass under the tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看!树下有三只羊在吃草。</font><br>\n
sheer	<h3>sheer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>完全的; 十足的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He achieved his aim by sheer strength of will.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他纯粹靠意志力达到了目的。</font><br>陡峭的; 垂直的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The waterfall makes a sheer drop of one thousand feet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 瀑布从一千英尺的高处直泻而下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mountain was too sheer to climb.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这山太陡峭了, 无法攀登。</font><br>极薄的, 轻的, 透明的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wears a pair of sheer stockings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她穿着一双透明的丝袜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That dress is too sheer to wear without a slip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那条连衣裙太透明了, 没有衬裙不能穿。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>垂直地, 陡峭地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mountain rises sheer from the plain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座山几乎是从草原上拔地而起。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>避开, 突然转向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boat came close to the rocks and then sheered away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船靠近岩石时突然掉转航向。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw her in the High Street, but she sheered off so as not to meet me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在大街上看见她, 但她故意避开我。</font><br>\n

silk	<h3>silk</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>丝, 绸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you match me the silk?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能帮我找一块和这相配的绸子吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She banded the birthday gift with a silk strip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用一根丝带扎好了生日礼物。</font><br>\n
silly	<h3>silly</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>蠢的, 傻的; 糊涂的, 可笑的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could not conceive that he would do such a silly thing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能想像他竟会干这种傻事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't be excused for such a silly reason.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不能因为这样一个可笑的理由而原谅你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't be silly!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别傻了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was silly to get out in the cold without a coat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我真傻, 大冷天没穿外衣就出门了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's silly to get out in the rain if you don't have to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 除非万不得已, 跑到外面淋雨就是愚蠢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was silly of him to do it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他居然会那么做, 真是太傻了。</font><br>〈非正〉不省人事的, 失去知觉的; 晕头转向的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I took a swing at him and knocked him silly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我挥拳打了他一下, 把他打得晕头转向。</font><br>\n
similarity	<h3>similarity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>类似, 相似<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were points of similarity between them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们之间有某些相似之处。</font><br>\n
similarly	<h3>similarly</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>相似地; 类似地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The brothers dress similarly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 兄弟俩穿得差不多。</font><br>也; 同样<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was late and I similarly was delayed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迟到了, 我也晚了。</font><br>\n
simmer	<h3>simmer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>炖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bring the potatoes to a simmer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将土豆微炖一会儿。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>炖; 慢煮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soup was left to simmer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤放在火上慢慢煮。</font><br>充满势将爆发的(怒气等)<br>\n
simultaneous	<h3>simultaneous</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>同时发生的; 同时存在的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two simultaneous shots sounded like one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那同时发出的两声枪响听起来像是一响。</font><br>\n
sin	<h3>sin</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>违背宗教[道德原则]的恶行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They live a life of sin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们过着不道德的生活。</font><br>罪恶, 罪孽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a sin to waste food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 浪费食品是一种罪过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lying, stealing, dishonesty and cruelty are sins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 说谎、偷窃、不诚实和残忍都是罪孽。</font><br>过错, 罪过; 愚蠢的事, 可耻的事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Being late is an unforgivable sin round here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 迟到在这里是一种不可原谅的失礼行为。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a sin to be indoors on holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 假期中待在家里实在是罪过。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>犯罪; 犯过错<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sinned against the unwritten rules of this meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们违反了这次会议的不成文规定。</font><br>\n
sincere	<h3>sincere</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(指感情或行为)真实的; 诚挚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He offered a sincere apology for his behaviour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他主动对自己的行为诚恳地道了歉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His apology was sincere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的歉意是出自内心的。</font><br>(指人)诚实的; 直率的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His mother is a sincere Christian.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他母亲是个虔诚的基督教徒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is sincere in her political beliefs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她忠实于自己的政治信仰。</font><br>\n

skeleton	<h3>skeleton</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>骨骼; 骷髅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy bent curiously to the skeleton of the buck.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这男孩好奇地弯下身去看鹿的骸骨。</font><br>骨干, 框架<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The block is still just a skeleton of girders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这片建筑还只是仅有主梁的骨架。</font><br>梗概, 提要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her notes gave us just the bare skeleton of her theory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的笔记只给我们提供了她的理论的梗概。</font><br>\n
sketch	<h3>sketch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>草图; 素描; 速写<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will send you a slight sketch of the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将给你寄去房屋的草图。</font><br>梗概, 大意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Give me a sketch of your plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 跟我谈谈你的计划梗概。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>素描; 作…的略图<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My sister often goes into the country to sketch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我姐姐常到乡间去写生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The historical article sketched the major events of the decade.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这篇有关历史的文章概述了这十年中的重大事件。</font><br>\n

skirt	<h3>skirt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>裙子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has several beautiful skirts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有几条很漂亮的裙子。</font><br>边缘, 外围<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lives on the skirts of the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他住在市郊。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>位于…的边缘; 沿…的边缘走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We skirted along one side of the valley.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们沿着山谷的一侧前进。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The workers skirted the edge of the cliff on a geological survey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人们沿着崖壁作了一次地质勘察。</font><br>绕开, 避开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They skirted round the village.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们绕过了村子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As he walked through the lobby, he skirted a group of ladies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他穿过门厅时, 绕过了一群女士。</font><br>\n
skull	<h3>skull</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>颅骨, 脑壳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The arrow pierced his skull.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 箭刺入他的头骨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He died in the car collision with his skull fractured.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在那次撞车事件中因头骨碎裂而死去。</font><br>\n
slam	<h3>slam</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>砰地关上(门或窗)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door slammed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门砰地关上了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In a fury he slammed the windows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他怒气冲冲, 砰地把窗户关上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He slammed the door shut.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他砰地把门关上了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>猛烈抨击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The film was slammed by many reviewers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电影受到许多评论者的猛烈抨击。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>猛然关闭的声音<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were surprised by the slam of a car door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关汽车门时发出的声音使他们很吃惊。</font><br>\n
slap	<h3>slap</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>掌击; 拍打<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The waves slapped against the boat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 波浪拍打着小船。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you touch me again I'll slap your face!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你若再碰我一下, 我就打你耳光。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>制止; 镇压<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They slapped the workers who had gone on strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们对参加罢工的工人大加镇压。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>掌击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I gave the scoundrel a slap in the face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打了那坏蛋一耳光。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>直接; 径直; 恰恰; 正好<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This path leads slap to the playground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条小路直接通到运动场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thief ran slap into a policeman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那小偷与警察撞个满怀。</font><br>\n
slash	<h3>slash</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>挥砍; 鞭打; 割破<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't slash your horse in that cruel way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要那样残忍地鞭打你的马。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scissors slashed his finger open.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剪刀将他的手指划开了一道伤口。</font><br>削减<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Price slashed!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 降价了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shop plans to slash fur prices after Spring Festival.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该店计划在春节之后把皮货降价。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>严厉地批评[谴责]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He slashed the Administration for its policies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他严厉地批评政府的政策。</font><br>\n

slick	<h3>slick</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>顺利而有效的, 不费力的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dancers gave a very slick performance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 舞蹈者的舞姿十分娴熟。</font><br>圆滑的, 油滑的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's precisely that sort of slick sales-talk that I mistrust.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不相信的正是那种油腔滑调的推销宣传。</font><br>光滑的, 滑溜的<br>\n
slogan	<h3>slogan</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>标语, 口号, 广告语<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crowd chanted slogans and waved banners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人群有节奏地呼喊着口号并挥舞着旗帜。</font><br>\n
slope	<h3>slope</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>斜坡, 斜面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On both slopes of the roof there are broken tiles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 屋顶的两面斜面都有破瓦片。</font><br>倾斜, 坡度, 斜率<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The floor is on a slight slope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地面略有倾斜。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>倾斜; 有斜度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The floor slopes badly here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地板在这儿倾斜得很厉害。</font><br>\n
slot	<h3>slot</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(机器或工具上的)狭缝, 狭槽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put a coin in the slot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将硬币放入投币口。</font><br>〈非正〉(在表册、系统等中所占的)位置, 职位, 空位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's been given a regular ten-minute slot on the radio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电台定期给他十分钟的节目广播时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There aren't any slots available until next month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在下个月之前都没有空位。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…放入狭长开口中; 把…纳入其中, 使有位置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You buy this bookcase in sections and slot them together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你分组件买这个书橱, 再把它们卡榫对准组合在一起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you slot her into a job in the sales department?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能把她安排在销售部工作吗?</font><br>\n
slump	<h3>slump</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>大幅度下降, 暴跌<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What caused the price of irons to slump?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 钢铁价格暴跌是什么原因?</font><br>沉重或突然地落下[倒下]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is very tired so he slumped into a chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他非常累, 所以一屁股坐在椅子上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>萧条期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Economists are forecasting a slump.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经济学家们预言将发生经济衰退。</font><br>〈美〉(个人、球队等的)低潮状态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is in a slump in her career.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她处在事业的低谷。</font><br>\n
smack	<h3>smack</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>拍, 打, 掴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She smacked a child's bottom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打孩子的屁股。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>掌掴(声); 拍击(声)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was being cheeky, so I gave him a smack on the jaw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他太无礼了, 所以我一拳打在他的下巴上。响吻</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>直接地, 准确地, 恰好地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There it was, smack in the middle of the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看, 它就在房间的正中央。</font><br>猛烈地, 急剧地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car ran smack into a wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车猛地撞在墙上。</font><br>\n

sound	<h3>sound</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>声音; 响声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sound travels slower than light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 声音传播比光慢。</font><br>印象, 感觉, 含义<br>播音, 录音<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)发出声音; 响<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bell sounded.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门铃响了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>发出…的信号<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sounded a note of danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她发出危险的信号。</font><br>探测<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were sounding the river.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在探测河水的深度。</font><br>试探, 探询<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you sound John as to whether he would accept the post when offered?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你试探一下约翰的意见, 如果让他干的话, 他是否会接受这个职位。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>健全的, 完好的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child has a sound mind in a sound body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子身心健康。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His heart is basically sound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的心脏基本上健康。</font><br>明智的, 有判断力的, 正确的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That's very sound advice; you should take it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是非常明智的忠告, 你应当接受。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His theory is perfectly sound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的理论完全正确。</font><br>彻底的, 完全的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made a sound investigation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们做了彻底的调查。</font><br>\n

sour	<h3>sour</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>有酸味的, 酸的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lemons have a sour taste.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 柠檬有股酸味。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most green fruit is sour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数未熟的水果都是酸的。</font><br>有发酵味道的, 酸腐的, 馊的<br>坏脾气的; 别扭的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She really looks sour this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她今天上午脾气的确有些坏。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使某物)变酸, 变馊; (使某人)阴郁<br>\n
sovereign	<h3>sovereign</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>君主, 国王, 女王<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp King George was the sovereign of England.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乔治王是英国的君主。</font><br>旧时价值为一镑的英国金币<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>控制国家的; 统治的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Queen has sovereign power.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 女王握有统治权。</font><br>独立自主的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For a brief time Texas was a sovereign nation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 得克萨斯一度是个主权独立的国家。</font><br>\n
sovereignty	<h3>sovereignty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>最高统治权, 君权<br>国家的主权<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sovereignty of these islands is in dispute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些岛屿的主权有争议。</font><br>\n
span	<h3>span</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>跨度, 跨径<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bridge has a span of 100 metres.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座桥跨度为一百米。</font><br>两个界限间的距离<br>一段时间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pupil's attention span was short.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个小学生的注意力持续时间很短。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>建造跨越(某物的)桥或拱; 横跨<br>跨越, 穿越, 贯穿<br>\n
sparkle	<h3>sparkle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>发火花, 闪耀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His eyes were sparkling with happiness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他眼里闪烁着幸福的光芒。</font><br>(饮料)发泡<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>光亮; 活力; 闪光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a sudden sparkle as her diamond ring caught the light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当她的钻石戒指遇到光时, 有阵突然的闪耀。</font><br>\n

stiff	<h3>stiff</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不易弯曲的, 硬的; 稠的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a sheet of stiff cardboard in the drawer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那个抽屉里有块硬纸板。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clay is very stiff; we must make it thinner with water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这粘土非常稠, 我们须用水使它变得稀一些。</font><br>僵硬的; 不灵活的; 一动就疼的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man's joints were stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个老人的关节不灵活了。</font><br>拘谨的, 冷淡的, 不友善的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lawyer nodded a stiff greeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个律师不自然地点头示意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their manner was rather stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的态度很生硬。</font><br>强烈的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need a stiff whisky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想喝点烈性的威士忌。</font><br>严厉的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He suffered a stiff punishment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他遭受了严厉的惩罚。</font><br>难对付的, 艰难的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We passed a stiff examination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们通过了一次艰难的考试。</font><br>很有决心的, 刚强的, 坚定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army encountered stiff resistance from rebels in the hills.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部队在山里遭到叛乱者顽强的抵抗。</font><br>太贵的, 无法接受的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He asked a stiff price for his used car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给自己的旧车开了个高价。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The asking price is too stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个要价太高。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>〈口〉极度地; 非常<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The play bored me stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这出戏剧使我非常腻烦。</font><br>\n

straw	<h3>straw</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>稻草, 麦秆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are a lot of straws in the shed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 棚子里有许多稻草。</font><br>吸管<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp May I have a straw for my drink?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我一根喝饮料的吸管好吗?</font><br>毫无价值的东西, 无意义的事情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't care a straw for your opinions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一点都不在乎你有什么看法。</font><br>\n
strawberry	<h3>strawberry</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>草莓<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wild strawberry is 2 cm long.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 野草莓有两厘米长。</font><br>\n
stray	<h3>stray</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>走失, 离群; 迷路<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child strayed away from home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子离家走失了。</font><br>走入歧途; 犯罪<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>走失的动物<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>独自的; 零散的<br>\n

strictly	<h3>strictly</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>严厉地; 严格地; 完全地; 绝对地<br>\n
stride	<h3>stride</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>大踏步走; 跨过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She strode purposefully up to the door and knocked loudly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她故意地大步走到门前, 并大声敲门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fence is so low that even a ten-year-old boy can stride it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 篱笆太矮, 连十几岁的孩子都能跨过去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大步<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He walked with long strides.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迈着大步走去。</font><br>步法; 步态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child could not keep up with his father's strides.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个孩子跟不上他父亲的步子。</font><br>\n

summary	<h3>summary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>摘要, 概要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a summary of what had been done.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总结了所做的事情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm giving you a summary of facts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将概述一下事实。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>即刻的, 立即的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was given the summary punishment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他当场就受到了处罚。</font><br>匆忙的, 草率的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She complained about the summary treatment given her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抱怨对她草率的对待。</font><br>概括的; 简要的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave a summary account.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给出了简要的说明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That is a summary and ironic end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是一个具有概括性和讽刺意味的结局。</font><br>\n

sun	<h3>sun</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>日, 太阳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At last the sun broke through the clouds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳终于穿云而出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was the first of August, a perfect day, with a burning sun and cloudless sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 八月一日这天, 阳光普照, 万里无云。</font><br>日光, 阳光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room never gets any sun at all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个房间从来不见阳光。</font><br>恒星<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our sun is only one of many suns in the heavens.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的太阳只是天际中许多恒星之一。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>晒太阳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sunned herself on the beach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在海滩上晒太阳。</font><br>\n

sunny	<h3>sunny</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>阳光充足的, 阳光明媚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a warm sunny day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是个温暖的阳光明媚的日子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This room is very sunny.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这间房阳光充足。</font><br>令人愉快的, 快活的, (性格)开朗的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The waiter has a sunny disposition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位侍者性格开朗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His nature was sunny.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他性情开朗。</font><br>\n
sunset	<h3>sunset</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>日落(时), 薄暮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stopped work at sunset.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们日落时收工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You get beautiful sunsets in the tropics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在热带地区可以看到美丽的落日余晖。</font><br>\n
sunshine	<h3>sunshine</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>阳光, 日光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We lie in the sunshine for hours, getting a tan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们躺在日光下几个小时进行日光浴。</font><br>快活, 愉快; 开朗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has brought some sunshine into my life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她给我的生活带来了几分快乐。</font><br>\n
superficial	<h3>superficial</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>表面(上)的; 表皮的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A superficial injury is not serious.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 表面的伤不太严重。</font><br>肤浅的, 浅薄的; 缺乏深度的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a superficial book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一本立论肤浅的书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a superficial knowledge of this subject.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对这门学科略知皮毛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's so superficial.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他非常浅薄。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You're too superficial to appreciate great literature like this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你太肤浅, 无法欣赏这类文学巨著。</font><br>\n

supper	<h3>supper</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>晚饭, 晚餐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is at supper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正在吃晚饭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had a wonderful supper yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天我吃了一顿很棒的晚饭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hotel is famous for its suppers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个酒店以晚餐而著称。</font><br>\n

suspicious	<h3>suspicious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>猜疑的, 疑心的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rabbit is timid and suspicious.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 兔子胆小而多疑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These words showed that Amelia was suspicious.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从这些话可看出阿米莉亚起了疑心。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm very suspicious about his motives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很怀疑他的动机。</font><br>可疑的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a suspicious character.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个可疑人物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A man was hanging about the house in a suspicious manner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个男人在房子周围可疑地荡来荡去。</font><br>表示怀疑的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police are suspicious of his alibi because he already has a record.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方对他不在场的辩解表示怀疑, 因为他已有前科。</font><br>\n
swallow	<h3>swallow</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>吞, 咽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He swallowed without chewing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他未经咀嚼就把食物咽下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put a grape into his mouth and swallowed it whole.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把一粒葡萄放入嘴里, 整个吞了下去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>不流露<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't know how I managed to swallow my anger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道怎样才能抑制住我的愤怒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was forced to swallow his pride and ask for money from his brother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不得不抛下面子, 从他弟弟那里求得资助。</font><br>〈口〉忍受; 轻信<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I found it hard to swallow his insults.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我真的很难忍受他的侮辱。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(吃或喝的)一口<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a few swallows of tea and then hurried out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他喝了几口茶, 就匆忙出去了。燕子</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One swallow doesn't make a summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一燕不成夏。</font><br>\n
swamp	<h3>swamp</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>沼泽(地)<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>淹没; 沉没<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Heavy rainfalls swamped the lowlands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大雨淹没了低地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A big wave swamped the boat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个巨浪淹没了那只小舟。</font><br>使困窘; 忙得不可开交<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are swamped with work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们被工作压得透不过气来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The firm is swamped with orders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大量订单使那家工厂应接不暇。</font><br>\n
swap	<h3>swap</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>交换<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This comic was a swap that I got from Nick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本漫画书是我从尼克那里换来的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>交换<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I liked her coat and she liked mine, so we swapped.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢她的外套, 她喜欢我的外套, 于是我们就交换了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will swap you my bicycle for your radio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想拿我的自行车换你的收音机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They swapped books with each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们互相交换了图书。</font><br>\n
sway	<h3>sway</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)摇摆, (使)摇动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dancers swayed to the music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 跳舞的人随着音乐节奏摇摆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He swayed his head from side to side with worry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忧心忡忡地频频摇头。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>影响、改变…的观点[行动]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His speech failed to sway his colleagues into supporting the plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的一番话没能使他的同事支持这项计划。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>摇摆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He felt the sway of the deck under his feet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他感觉到脚下甲板的摇动。</font><br>支配; 统治<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In medieval times the church held sway over many countries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在中世纪, 教会支配着许多国家。</font><br>\n
swear	<h3>swear</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>诅咒; 咒骂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His boss often swore at him, sometimes for no reason at all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老板经常骂他, 有时毫无理由。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使某人)就…宣誓<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't know anything about what happened, I swear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我发誓, 我对所发生的事一无所知。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They swore an oath to carry out their duties faithfully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们宣誓忠实履行自己的职责。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He swore to obey the king.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发誓服从国王。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He swore that he had put the papers in that drawer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发誓说, 他是把文件放在那个抽屉里的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>〈非正〉断言, 明确地表示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I swear he's a swindler.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我肯定他是个骗子。</font><br>\n

swift	<h3>swift</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>迅速的, 速度快的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A swift clap of thunder woke me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一阵突然的雷鸣把我惊醒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is as swift of foot as a hare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跑得像兔子一样快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave them a swift glance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迅速地朝他们瞥了一眼。</font><br>敏捷的, 反应快的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a swift wit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有急智。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is swift to hear, but slow to speak.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他听力敏锐, 但不善言辞。</font><br>\n

sympathetic	<h3>sympathetic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>表示同情的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a sympathetic person.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一个有同情心的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was very sympathetic when my mother died.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她对我母亲的去世深表同情。</font><br>赞同的, 支持的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were quite sympathetic to our proposals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们很赞同我们的建议。</font><br>\n
symphony	<h3>symphony</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>交响乐, 交响曲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They play over the whole symphony.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把整个交响乐重新演奏了一遍。</font><br>\n
syndicate	<h3>syndicate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>辛迪加, 企业联合组织, 财团<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two syndicates are bidding for the contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两家财团正在竞投该合约。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)联合组成辛迪加<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>(通过报业联合组织)出售(稿件)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company syndicates cartoons to newspapers across the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司向全国各地的报纸出售漫画卡通。</font><br>\n
syndrome	<h3>syndrome</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>综合征<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The spots on his throat are part of a syndrome.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他嗓子里的红斑是一种综合征的部分症状。</font><br>(某种条件下有共同特征的)一系列表现(事件、举动等)<br>\n
systematic	<h3>systematic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>有系统的; 有规则的; 彻底的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher made a systematic work of teaching.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个教师进行系统的教学工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The way he works isn't very systematic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的工作不是很有条理。</font><br>\n

tack	<h3>tack</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大头钉, 平头钉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is hammering a tack into the wall to hang a picture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正往墙上钉一枚平头钉用来挂画。</font><br>航向, 换向; 方法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The captain ordered a change of tack.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船长下令改变航向。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you cannot persuade him, try a new tack and offer him money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你说服不了他, 那就换一种方法, 给他钱。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用平头钉钉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tacked the sheets of paper on as carefully as possible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他尽量小心地把纸张钉上去。</font><br>附加, 增补<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After negotiation, they tacked two new clauses on to the end of the contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通过协商, 他们在合同末尾处又加上了两项新条款。</font><br>\n

tag	<h3>tag</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>加标签于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tag the bottles now!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在给这些瓶子贴上标签吧！</font><br>以特殊的方式评价[描述]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He often tags his speeches with poetry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他常引用诗句添饰他的演讲以增强效果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One may tag this book traditional.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们可以称这本书为传统作品。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>标签, 签条<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you put tags on your luggage?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在自己的行李上贴上标签了吗?</font><br>名言, 警句<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old scholar's writing is always full of tags.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位老学者的文章里总是有很多名言警句。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>褴褛的<br>\n
tailor	<h3>tailor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>裁缝<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tailor has cut my coat very well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 裁缝把我的外衣裁得很好。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>裁制<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This material tailors well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种布料容易缝制成衣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tailored several suits when he went to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他开始上班时做了几套西服。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tailored me several suits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为我缝制了几套衣服。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>调整使适应<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clinic tailors its treatment to individual need.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家诊所根据患者不同的病情采取相应的治疗方法。</font><br>\n

tan	<h3>tan</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>黄褐色, 棕黄色<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These shoes are tan, not dark brown.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些鞋是棕黄色的, 不是深褐色的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)晒成棕褐色<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tanned quickly in the sun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在太阳下很快晒黑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's small wonder you got tanned, staying out in the sun all that time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你老是暴露在太阳底下, 难怪晒得那么黑。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>硝制(皮革)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tanners tan hides to make leather shoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 硝皮工人硝皮以制作皮鞋。</font><br>\n
